text: hip place, great food.  nice decor.
Amazing food, cocktails and service. Brian at the bar made our service one of a kind and was very knowledgeable.

The place is nice, good atmosphere and such. Now the food... Well, I've had better sushi, especially for the prices they were charging. The drinks were all right, but once again, they were a bit overpriced.

Been looking for a good sushi place since we moved from California in September...and we finally found it! We live in Glendale so it's not too close to our house but when we are craving sushi, we will be making the drive for this place.. The atmosphere and food is great and the service is even better! The owner greeted us when we sat down and the server was amazing! You can tell they focus on keeping their customers happy. We went crazy on the happy hour and enjoyed everything we ordered! Well done!

Had dinner here tonight and was impressed with the quality if the sushi which was during happy hour. My husband has baked sea bass and he enjoyed the meal. The service was friendly and quick and we had a pleasant evening. I would recommend this place and hope to return before I leave Scottsdale.

Really good happy hour specials and hours considering they offer the menu on the weekends from 11-6. The calamari was crispy and fresh with an Asian style pesto sauce which was different but delicious. We got three rolls: Philly, Pure Crunch and Pure Fire Dragon. Each was dirt cheap on happy hour but tasted far from cheap. The Philly was pretty standard except it had some nice sized chunks of fresh tuna. The Crunch had a tasty eel sauce and of course a crunchy exterior that was really yummy too. For me, the Fire Dragon stole the show. First, it was a huge portion for the price and had a great balance between sweet, salty and spicy. It was one of the best rolls I have ever had in Scottsdale. Needless to say the three $8 saki bombers I enjoyed made everything taste better not that the food needed the help. I got five bombs out of each order which is more than I expect but much appreciated. My gf got the Cool Cucumber cocktail with gin and loved it. It was strong enough to enable me to convince her to go across the parking lot to check out another bar and more cocktails. The service and atmosphere were both pretty decent. Not memorable for being amazing or terrible which is a plus compared to most places. Overall, we will be back. Based on the food, prices and saki volume I would recommend Pure for happy hour over Ra, Stingray and Sapporo. It is a close call between this place and Sushi Brokers. Round #2 will be necessary to make such a call.

Two words: crunchy rice.   I'm sorry, but for $15 a roll the rice shouldn't be crunchy, and it should stick together enough to get the piece to your mouth.   Nigiri wasn't helped by the rice either.   Fish quality seemed fine, but the art is in the rice and this was a failure on the level of grocery store sushi.   I would suggest spending your $60-$75 on some quality ingredients and cooking for yourself.

My husband and I have always wanted to try Pure, but with so many sushi options (and favorites) in our area, it took us much longer than usual to get there. Happy to report it is now on the top of our list! Contrary to other posts, our service was excellent, the quality was great and pricing fair as well. We had 20 minutes left on happy hour,which was great to save a bit on numerous items. Great feel inside...we will definitely be back.

We are lucky to have Pure as our closest option for Sushi.  We have been several times and i'm sure we will go many more.    We have tried many different items and have never been disappointed.  We can recommend any of the specialty rolls, but love the Vegas, Dragon and Lobster rolls.  They also have a number of cooked dinner options for those who don't like raw and we have tried a few of them with good results.  The decor has a modern theme and pretty cool.  They also have a misted or heated patio (depending on the time of year) that is a nice option as well.  Staff has always been friendly and helpful.  My one complaint is that it is priced on the high side, which when it is your local place makes it more difficult to go as often as we would like.

Pure Sushi is simply the best place in AZ for sushi... In reality I can't say I've had a better sushi roll even at places like Nobu or the high end sushi in Hawaii. We love the Happy Hour as the regular menu can be on the pricy side. We come here once a week. Do not pass on the Creamy Baked Lobster roll or my personal fave the Poke.
Yum!  You have to come here for happy hour.  Great food, excellent happy hour menu and beautiful atmosphere!

Solid three stars, but really can't be more than that. Place was quite packed on a Saturday night, and I really don't get it. The Fish was pretty fresh, but overall the sushi was just OK. Really, good sushi is a lot about the rice, and the rice really just was not well prepared. I got the ama ebi and the fried heads did not come out hot and were somehow not cooked enough... I was picking pieces of shrimp shell out of my teeth! our waitress was very nice, but it took a while for what little we ordered to come out and unfortunately, they put us next to the loudest people possible!   Also quite pricey for what you've got. Overall, disappointed

My husband and I went there for happy hour. We almost ordered everything from the happy hour menu, and everything was excellent! We sat on the patio, and was very relaxing. The service was great. We suggest ordering the Goyza, California Roll, Crunchy Roll, and anything with the fries. We will be definitely going back.

Nice contemporary atmosphere, good service, and good sushi rolls ... and very good price for Happy Hours   Went there for sunday lunch, they have happy hours (yes, even on sunday)  Selected sushi rolls and appetizers were half price ... some drinks special as well  Ordered couple of HH sushi rolls, most are ok but I like the fire dragon rolls the best ... it really gets a good kick to it .... if you like spicy, it's a great choice ... ended up ordering a second one ... it was that good  Will be coming back some other time to try other things they have offer

Pure Sushi typifies what a high-end sushi place should be...a mix of a simple, casually-upscale atmosphere (including a terrific patio area), lounge music that sets the mood without drowning out conversation, good service and, of course, excellent sushi (and other menu items). It's definitely on the high-end of the price spectrum, and sure you could get sushi as good for half the price elsewhere, but it's not your weekly sushi place...you come here for the vibe. Pure is a great choice for a date or nice night out with friends or family. I'm thrilled to have this place in my neighborhood and hope it sees continued success (they must be doing something right, if they opened a second location in Old Town).

This place has an EXCELLENT happy hour (3 to 6)!  Everything I had was delicious and the sushi was fresh and prepared with care.  The staff was very kind and seemed to work well together which made for a great environment to enjoy a wonderful meal.  The place looks surprisingly normal from the outside but is a true gem inside.  Great experience all around.

Despite the name, Pure Sushi isn't for Sushi purists...but if you're a fan of rolls, then good times may be found here.    Pure Sushi is all about monster rolls...with fillings that ranges from crabs to shrimp tempura to deep fried soft shell crabs...and over the top are things like salmon, halibut & scallops...and to top it all of, you get wide range of sauces from sweet onion salsa to sweet chili to  kiwi yuzu.   Also good selection of bento box lunches though the loungy atmosphere and thumping music can feel slightly off in the bright Phoenix noon day.    Really just 3 stars for the food, but we added an extra star for the spacious patio and cool decor.

This place used to be good.  We were regulars   Now, the food just doesn't seem fresh.  This includes the fish and vegetables.  Just today the asparagus and cucumbers were brown and the tuna tasted old.   Hope the owners are able to right this ship.

Pure is in the Grayhawk Plaza in Scottsdale so understandeably is located in a very hip location. I went there on Sunday with my friend for lunch and was plesantly surprised to find they have happy hour on the weekends too!! The HH are from noon to 6 pm so we could eat to our hearts content at very cheap prices. The food was very good, we ordered all different kinds of rolls- california, salmon, rainbow, crunchy . The helpings are also very good, 8 in one plate so quite filling. The staff was attentive and the ambience was also pleasing. It may be more expensive otherise but given they have happy hours everyday of the week, Id certainly go back during those times.
Food was fresh and fabulous!  The proportions were big and tasty! Our server (Kristen) was excellent!

Wow, what a great place. Not your typical looking Sushi Bar, no Jap theme here - very modern. Yes, the $$$ is high, but most Sushi places are. Just a way cool place. The only thing that would make it better for me, is free wi-fi.. Sorry always working.. LOL.

I love this place! The sushi is so fresh and the service is so friendly. I love that my favorite waitress, Kristen, always knows what we want. We go there quite often and so we don't even have to order. She knows that we are trying to do less carbs so she will alter each dish a little for us. For example, instead of taro chips with our ahi poke we will get lettuce wraps instead. It's the little things like that that makes dining there so great after a long day at the office!   They have Zipang, a delicious sparkling sake. A must try if you love bubblies! They have a great wine selection as well.   We love to sit out in there patio when the weather is nice. The bar seating is great and so is sushi bar seating. Not a bad seat in the house! Great ambiance! I can tell this is a very well managed place! The parking is never an issue so this is one of our favorite sushi places!

I am very thankful for Pure in North Scottsdale.  There aren't many good sushi places in the Phoenix Metro area, Pure helps fill the void.  I've been 5 times and have always been happy.  The fish is extremely fresh and cut very well by the sushi chefs.  I always get the Hamachi sashimi, salmon, and tuna sushi, and the Fire Dragon roll.  These items are always outstanding.  The other rolls such as the Albacore Ceviche Roll and the spicy tuna roll are also good.    I usually love rainbow rolls, however, I am not a big of it at Pure.  They use crab mix, instead of straight crab, which grosses me out a little bit.  Too creamy!  The salmon, tuna, shrimp, and avocado that they put on top of the rainbow roll is sliced so thin, you can't even taste it.  This is my only complaint thus far with Pure.  The drink menu is great.  I love the Lychee and Pear Martinis and the cold unfiltered sake.  The drinks can get a little pricey, so be careful.    They also have some Japanese appetizers, salads, and dinner entrees, which I have never had.  I've just stuck with sushi.  But if you don't eat sushi, there are other items that you can get.  The atmosphere is contemporary and beautiful.  Service is always solid.  They have a large table in the 2nd dining room for larger parties.  Great for Birthdays or groups that are celebrating.    Overall, I highly recommend Pure for fresh and tasty sushi and rolls.

I'm brand new to Yelp and it's about time I've let people know about Pure Sushi! I've been here dozens of times. It's extremely consistent and clean. The menu is imaginative and the service is impeccable. They are knowledgable about the menu and very friendly.  You can't miss with the crisp curried lobster spring rolls, the papaya slaw compliments the dish well. The fish is so fresh that you can still taste the sea water on the tuna! Bright red - FRESH! Come here soon, you'll probably see me.

Ate here on a quiet Sunday evening. The sushi & sashimi is quite good, but the service is terrible. We were greeted by a yawning hostess, had 3 different servers over the course of an hour, had to ask for parts of our meal, and were made to feel that it was an imposition to serve us. In this economy, restaurants are fighting to keep a customer base. Pure is not.

Hostess - next time I should take note of the warning sign; when a restaurant hires a 16 year old in a crop top who flaunts attitude as a hostess...turn and walk out. I didn't. Shame on me.   Decor - great, actually. Too bad it wasn't edible. Food certainly wasn't.  Waitress - service was friendly, albeit a little confused. Request for hot, green tea resulted in ice tea. Upon return, was offered some green concoction that was hot, green and tasted like seaweed. Sorry - this notcha macha!  Gyoza - yowza! Strike one.   Miso - the star of the night. It's virtually impossible to screw up miso soup.  Sushi nigiri - I had tuna, salmon, yellowtail and shrimp. These are the most popular items sold in any sushi restaurant...Not a single one was fresh. Rice was very undercooked. Ginger stank.   Sashimi bowl - my wife is in agony now after eating only 4 bites.   Pure Sushi - shame on you.   Scottsdale residents - I'm an out of towner, I have an excuse. Why you all have been giving this place good reviews and are returning is beyond me.   Bad. Really bad.

We went there for sushi. Ordered a few of the standard items found on all menus. Also ordered what the call "lollipops" (cucumber is used instead of rice). Cleaver idea - sorta awkward to eat, but tastes very good. Overall presentation of the other sushi items was thoughtfully created. I like! Drinks are a generous pour. Decor is modern, clean, hip. Clientele is 20-40s something. We went Friday night and it was jam packed from like 530 to almost 8! We had a 730 reservations - do make a reservation.  Would I go again? In a heart beat. Outstanding place. Bravo!

Food is pretty decent, and prices aren't horrible. The downside is the service, which isn't a matter of slow servers, but a lazy manager. Both times we've gone for lunch, there's been one server and one bartender, both working full speed. And then a manager playing on his phone sitting on his thumb. Even watched him being asked for help, and he made a joke out of it and seemingly shrugged it off. So, the place is worth checking out, but unless you see your server standing around, don't blame them for the slow service, chances are they're overburdened by trying to make up for an empty suit.
Great service. Great vibes. Great drinks. Great music. Hands down best sushi in Scottsdale. Plus, they had the World Cup of Hockey on, gotta love it.
Enjoying an amazing birthday dinner with family and friends... With a sushi feast to make the gods green with jealousy!

Just realized my last review for Pure was two years ago! Time for a update! And yes, I have been back a few times in the past years, and my experience has just gotten better and better! Thanks for your improvement, Pure! Now that you are offering happy hours, it definitely made it better :) Especially the weekend noon - 6 times!

I have been anxious to try this spot as it is a half block from my house. I am a huge fan of sushi and Japanese food.   Unfortunately Pure Sushi was mediocre in food then less desirable in service. In sitting at the bar, one would assume the approach would be one on one. Friendly. Even possible or hopefully personable. The bar here is a far cry from such notions.  Be it the food is not expertly prepared. I kinda expected that. The lack of service and care at the bar would have still brought me back for a second go. The female brunette bar keep would walk aimless from one task to the next without care that she had a guest at the bar. Nose in air and seemingly no thought of guest services or what she was actually getting paid to do.  Way to disappoint...

I recently moved to area and was having trouble finding great sushi. Pure is kind of hidden in a shopping center, but I'm so glad I found it! The decor is nice and you definitely get the first impression that this is a clean, quality restaurant. The sushi is top notch. I particularly love the Dragon Roll and the Pure Vegas Roll. The fish is fresh and the sushi chefs are friendly. I feel totally at ease as a solo diner at the sushi bar. My only complaint is that the waitstaff is less than attentive, but the food more than makes up for it.

This place is super mediocre. We ordered sushi rolls that were not made with sushi rice so the rolls had a funny tasting texture to what we're normally accustomed to when eating sushi rolls. The only redeeming factor to the meal with the bowls. We had the chirashi bowl and also the eel bowl. Eel bowl was not bad but not great. The chriashi bowl was actually pretty decent. Overall, not great food .
Great service, extremely friendly staff and the Manager "Julius " is terrific. Nice contemporary atmosphere and the food is mouth watering.
Get the Box Sushi... Excellent flavor variety and best of all it is unique! The service is friendly too

By far, the best sushi place I have been to yet. Kind of a drive for me in Tempe, but worth it.  The interior is just stunning with draping white curtain sperating certain tables and new-age square lanterns on the ceilings and walls. A sushi bar and drink on opposite sides with a small, private room opposite the hostess stand.   My sorority sister and I sat outside on the wrap around patio which was lined with tables. We went during thier Sunday happy hour (love sunday hapy hours) and got the best service. We order adamane, the crunchy roll, fire dragon roll, Philly roll, California roll. Rolls came in 5 pieces but for half the prices as non-happy hour rolls. They were delish.   Between us we split the bill in half and with tip, each paid about $20 which for 6 rolls, an app and drinks... I thought was really awesome.  The place is located in an upscale shopping center.

we visited the scottsdale location on a sunday afternoon and were the only customers at that time. The service was slow and the food portions were small and overpriced the taste was just average... i'd much rather go to RA

Pure Sushi has great food, although a little pricey.  Normally I order sushi, but this last time I opted to order the filet. It was surprisingly good, with a Japanese/Asian twist.  The atmosphere is modern with a boutique feel and has a really cool bar.  The service was great, very friendly, and knowledgable staff.

The food is more generic each time I go. You can definitely tell there's been a change of ownership! Quality is lacking as is the service. My salad must have been shaken out of a bag - seriously? Their version of sushi is like Pei Wei is to Asian Food (think WalMart with Nieman Marcus pricing!)

Pullled in here for the first time after work, it's nearby and decided to finally try.  I waited MUCH too long.  This bistro tops the Stingray locations anyday.  I was actually pretty much sold right when I walked in, since the atmosphere and decor completely clear the nervous system of any stress.  I took my place at the Sushi bar, and was thoroughly charmed by DJ, who seemed to be the head Chef that evening.  Not only was what I ordered delicious, perfectly fresh, and gorgeous to look at -- DJ kept plying me with all sorts of ingenious and remarkable creations of his (Monkfish Liver with Blackberry Emulsion?  Weird?  Hardly.  A must try).  Perfect in every way, and DJ needs to have his own Food Network Show.   Run here, and let the place take you to a truly Higher Plane of Happiness!

I have come here on many occasions and am always happy when I leave. The lunches are huge and delicious, I have tried the Salmon Avocado Bowl and a few of the bento boxes, all of which were delicious. The staff is always very friendly as well.

I just love this place! Been here three times now. Had their latest creation, the WHite Monster Roll, and my favorite is the Lobster Roll. Very busy last ime because of Phoenix Open. Everyone was working hard, yet still had impatient customers. For us, our service was perfect. Folks! Good food takes time! If you want instant fast food, go where they preoare food from a can or a bag and microwave! This is beautiful, and excellent prepared sushi! Great service.

We ended up here because of attending the Phoenix Film Festival.  Wanting something light before sitting through a movie sushi seemed to be the logical choice.  We chose Pure for the proximity to the festival and the Yelp reviews.  All I can say is "what in the world are people thinking".  I know we are spoiled by having Hana and Nobu in our backyard.  This place is not quality sushi, it is not a quality restaurant.  I recognize how "lucky" we were to be seated at 6:15 on a Friday night.  We were ok with the hustle of the food since we were on our way someplace.  I take exception to the quality of the fish.  First we ordered a dragon roll which was served on a very warm plate.  Cold sushi, warm plate = not good.  My sashimi was poor quality being soggy and tasteless.  Frozen too long, thawed or stored incorrectly?  Not sure, tasted like sponge.  We did have a misorder which we will take full responsibility for ordering some faux, convoluted lobster roll.   Then our table was cleared and our final plate came out to which my husband and I forgot we ordered and apparently the waitress did also.  We took it to go.  Because my stomach is not feeling well today I doubt it will get eaten.  Note to host, hostesses, since we were seated next to the host/hostess stand we do not wish to here about your sex life and how you took advantage and humiliated some woman you were dating.  I expect that from a 18 year old at Fridays not a 40 something anywhere.   Tonight we are going to Hana or Nobu and repent for even thinking we could obtain the quality and ambience at Pure B.S.
Love this place!!! Happy hour is amazing... We order 7 different app plates and share them and leave full! The prices you can't beat. You won't be disappointed coming here!

I'm not a fan of fish so my review is not based on the quality of the sushi, although I do like their California Rolls. I've had their teriyaki, noodle dishes and soups.  I've eaten here several times and the food (remember, not talking about the sushi) is always good, not spectacular, but good. It's everything you would expect from a nicer sushi place just on fancier, interestingly shaped plates. Though the staff is friendly, service is extremely slow. I just ate lunch there; I ordered the chicken yakisoba and my friend ordered the sushi lunch special. When we arrived there were 2 other tables of 2. Because of this I was expecting our food to come out pretty quickly but instead we waited nearly 45 minutes for our food to arrive. That's just way too long of a wait in my opinion. Of course our server was attentive, refilling our drinks and what not but we were hungry and did not want to spend all afternoon on lunch.  I'm sure you won't be disappointed in the quality of the sushi, just don't expect timely service.

Pure has an incredible happy hour on Saturdays and Sundays. The prices are amazing, sushi was fresh, and the atmosphere was great during the college bowl games. We had two small children with us, and the staff went above and beyond to accommodate us. Our server's name was Jess and she was great! We will be checking this place out again in the near future. If you have a group of 8 or more call ahead and reserve the front room, it has its own private television and allows for a more private experience.

AHHH MAZING!  Kelly, our server, made the trip there 4 stars alone.  She was so friendly and kind and looked like she really enjoyed her job!   Since we were there during AZ restaurant week, we ordered from that menu.  For appetizers, I had the tempura, mom had the tuna and avocado poke, and dad had the bbq ribs w/sweet potato fries.  The appetizers had so much food that they could've been their own meal!  The tempura was fried crispy and included 3 big shrimp plus several vegetables.  Mom's tuna poke was melt in your mouth yummy, and dad's ribs were fall of the bone good!  After that deliciousness, the main entrees came out.  My mom and i ordered sushi...with the restaurant week menu, we had our choice of two rolls - one regular and one specialty.  I had the CA roll and the lobster roll (to die for!).  Mom had the spicy shrimp and the dynamite roll (also to die for!)..the only thing i didn't like was the eel sauce on the lobster roll, but that is just me.  Dad had the sea bass and it was delish.  Since we were celebrating my birthday, the server brought out my dessert (included in restaurant week menu) with ice cream and a candle!  I was relieved they didn't sing :).    Overall a great place, good vibe, and nice atmosphere.  I just wish they weren't so far away!

We came here for happy hour before the Sun's game for a quick bite to eat.  As soon as we walked through the door, the delightful owner greeted us and sat us down right away! Kellie was our server and she was amazing! We ordered just off the happy hour menu and everything we had was SO DELICIOUS. We're from Vancouver, BC so we've had our fair share of sushi and this place, well...let's just say I wish it was in Vancouver too! Order the dragon roll, tuna poke and lobster roll. You will not regret it. We're actually thinking of going back before we head home! A MUST VISIT!

The first time I ate here, I was in the middle of moving into a new apartment. My husband and I were not very dressed up, but this was the only place still serving dinner, and we were starving. Despite our casual attire, the staff was super friendly and attentive. The interior may be modern, but the service is old fashioned nice.   I have since been back and enjoyed each visit. While they are not breaking any new ground here, the sushi is fresh and tasty and the cocktails are excellent. There is also a nice wine selection and lots of other Japanese food.   Do not be scared off by the all white, super-chic scottsdale look - this is a good place for a date or an evening with friends.

5 years ago this place was awesome. We don't know what happend. The service was really bad. We saw one of the cooks eating gum. We think that is not professional. So sorry we don't like to give 1 star but this is how we feel. I know is very hard to please everybody.

We love this place. I'll let everyone else brag about the sushi because it's amazing. But I want to shout out to the best margarita I've ever had! They call it a margarita martini, and it's amazing. I know, I know, a margarita at a sushi place? Trust me! Try it.

Very good sushi.  Sat outside and watched the first half of the Thursday Night Football game here!  It was cold out, but the heaters they have hanging from the ceiling made it very comfortable.  Very cool layout, very nice sitting area inside, nice seating area outside, and an awesome bar!  Plenty of options, whether you want to be there to enjoy time with family, or to go enjoy a football game with some buddies... It is a perfect place for both.   Very friendly staff, after the hostess sat us, I asked her what sushi roll she recommended, she said the "White Monster Roll".... I got it.... It was bomb.  It was a bit more expensive than other sushi places I have been to, but the food and experience makes it worth every dime.   I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for good sushi and a great time!  Thanks Pure.

In a word . . . Disappointed!   We arrived in time for Happy Hour and ordered a number of items from the discounted HH menu -- gyoza, sliders, shrimp tempura, fire dragon rolls and calamari. They brought everything at once -- it hardly fit on the table. Since everything was cooked, by the time we got around to eating it, after trying to organize the platters and dishes on the table, everything was cold. Most of the dishes were tasty, but the soggy calamari with asian pesto dipping sauce was abominable! We also had the sashimi platter and tuna tataki. As always, the fish was fresh and melt in your mouth.  I have always been a huge fan of Pure Sushi . . . but the service we received on an early Tuesday evening was mediocre at best. At three minutes after 6 pm (the end of HH), our server asked if we wanted another drink. Three minutes after 6!!!  A conscientious server would have come by three minutes to 6 and said, HH is over in a few minutes, would you like to order another drink, or last call for HH . . . and then, as I wrote above, all the items coming out at one time . . . should never have happened that way.  I hope this is just an anomaly because I have really loved this place since it first opened. I hope it is not just riding on its reputation.
Service was good, Sushi is priced high for the portion size served. I can say that we were served the smallest rolls in my entire life of eating Sushi.

Reasonable fishes for the sashimi platter, a little warmer than it should be. Vegetable Udon was below my expectation, vegetables were over cooked and sauce was not right one.  This restaurant is three star level from the California standard.

My date introduced me to the Lobster Roll, his favorite and now I know why. We will definitely be ordering that again. We also shared the Caterpillar Roll though I've had better. The Molten Lava dessert with vanilla ice cream was well worth it. For drinks, the Buddha Beer with bottle shaped like a buddha was great fodder for conversation (the server suggested taking it home to use as a flower vase).

Some girlfriends and I were spending a weekend in Tempe and really wanted to enjoy a nice sushi dinner. We found great reviews about Pure here on Yelp. We had a reservation during happy hour and planned to head to some bars in old town Scottsdale after dinner. Unfortunately we failed to map the place out and didn't realize that North Scottsdale is quite a distance from downtown Scottsdale where we had been spending a lot of our time. After a $50+ cab ride from Tempe we were in a funk and just hoping it would be worth it. It definitely was! All the staff was so friendly and helpful. Our waitress, Kellie, was great about answering questions and making recommendations. The food was incredible, probably some of the best tasting and freshest fish all three of us have ever had. We tried just about every roll on the happy hour menu and they were all delicious, especially the dragon roll. The happy hour prices were an insanely good deal and we ended up spending just barely more than our cab ride over for an amazing dinner with several glasses of wine, as well. On top of all of this, despite our table being reserved for a party coming in after us, we were not rushed through our meal and Kellie even brought over a complimentary dessert and told us they appreciated us coming so far out of our way to visit their restaurant. After speaking to another super friendly waitress and bartender to get recommendations for bars to head to we left the restaurant feeling completely taken care of and more than satisfied with our choice. I would absolutely come back here for the amazing service and wonderful food!
Happy Hour: 3-6pm= great rolls + great prices!!!  Service: very attentive and friendly   Ambiance: nicely decorated and clean

I first tried out Pure Sushi at the South location, which I loved. Just last week, we ventured north to this location, and it is equally amazing. Nobody does it better (not RA, not stingray, not Kabuki, not Sushi Roku). The fish is exquisitely fresh, and the artistry is amazing. My favorites are the salmon sashimi, the white monster, the dragon, the philadelphia (with raw salmon), and the rainbow. Maybe especially the rainbow. The mango ice cream for desert is also fabulous.  I just love this place.
Great service and food.  Made it just in time for Happy Hour.  Our server Kristen was super helpful and made it a great experience.  Our new sushi place.

Overpriced sushi with underwhelming service and just OK fish. First, our nigiri order was mixed up. Normally this wouldn't be a big deal, but, it took 40 minutes to be corrected.  The part of the night that ensured I will not be returning to Pure was watching the man who was checking the orders smell our lollipop roll, ask a waitress "Should we remake this?", then proceed to give it to us with the explanation, "Your roll has truffle oil on it. If it doesn't taste good we'll remake it for you." AKA someone spilled truffle oil on our sushi and they tried to just give it to us. Obviously, Pure does not know what quality control is and the restaurant is too cheap to remake one lollipop roll for a customer with a 100$+ tab. Tonight was unacceptable. Won't be returning.

Been to Pure about 5 times over the course of the past year and it is consistently impressive every time. We've sat at the bar, the sushi bar, and at tables in the dining room and all options are enjoyable. Great drinks too. I would've shied away due to it being in a shopping center, albeit a nice one, but I'm very glad I didn't.

I was here previously and it was great so  chalking this visit up to me not ordering their best options. The food was mediocre at best. Service from the server was good. I rarely post reviews, but after having sat at the sushi bar and hearing the manager bark his comments at the chefs, I feel like I need to report him.  My sympathies to the chefs that are working so hard and have to follow the direction of someone who wishes he had real power. I'll be back, just to do another sample of food and see if the chefs are still alive.
You must go for the happy hour deal. Great prices for sushi and drinks with a very good but smaller menu. Service great, food great, ambience good, what more do you need.

Ate here last night with hubby and had a reservation for 7:45.   We got there a bit early and had a drink at the bar.  I had the caipirinha which was good and hubby had the Asian Pear martini - which was very refreshing.  We were called to our table and, even though my husband had asked to sit next to me, they sat us at a small table where they then turned it on the longer side so we could sit next to one another.  Thankfully we like each other because we were definitely in each others space all night during dinner.  It really got to us when a couple came in 1/2 hour after us, no reservation and they get the 4-top right next to us and they sat next to each other.  Nice way to treat a reservation!  We had the Tuna Carpaccio (very good), the calamari tempura (eh, fried very crisp but the sauce wasn't great), Tuna and avocado Poke (very yummy).  We had ordered 2 rolls for dinner and a Sashimi plate with a side of rice.  They brought out the rice right away - and I had to send it back otherwise it would have gotten cold waiting on the entrees.  We got the Sashimi and it really was very fresh and tasty.  We had the black cod, yellowtail, ahi tuna and salmon.  Dude -- very fresh and really great cuts of fish.  We scarfed down the plate in no time.  We ordered hot sake as well and it comes in little baby bottles.  You would think it was made out of gold.  Then the waiter came by and asked if there was anything else we wanted -- he had forgotten our rolls.  Ok, just make us another sashimi plate -- yum.  Yes, it was that good to order it again.    The food was good, the place is very pretty but there really is no one managing the place thats a "grown up".  The girls at the hostess stand were way too young to call the shots and the waitstaff is very young as well -- they need a manager.  I think there are alot of places out there where you can get really good fresh Sushi. The service here really lacked -- and this place is not cheap.  Oh, and hey guys?  The people you sat at the 4-top ate one appetizer, one round of drinks and they split one entree.  They spent about half what we did -- and I'm sure they'll be back.  Not sure we will though...

My boyfriend and I tried Pure Sushi a couple weeks ago after we had been craving sushi. We went pretty late on a Saturday so the dinner crowd was gone. The sushi was fresh and delicious. We ordered 3 roles and that was plenty. We liked each one!

SO DISAPPOINTED!  Have been a regular on weekends for their fantastic happy hour that began at 12noon. Went to go today and in their infinite wisdom decided to cut that out a changed the times,now 3-6. We will not be back.

After bed experience in 2012 and avoiding this place for about 2 years, decided to give another shit, was pleasantly surprised with changes, very nice menu with good choices in sushi tools as well as main dishes, after several visits looks like they now take service mostly better than before, waiters has no ledge about dishes and special and more available than in my first experience overload good dinning choice for average bill 50-60  dollars per person

Easily forgettable.  Nothing really stands out.  Ok in a pinch but so many better places with knockout sushi.  We asked for their hottest roll the fire dragon.  Decent taste but heat level is laughable.  Tuna tataki was way over cooked and resembled chicken in taste.  The biggest disappointment the Toro.  Poor poor quality.  Save your hard earned money and sanity.

12 year anniversary. My wife and I Love great sushi and this place is definitely it. Beautiful atmosphere, great service our server was Arianna she was very accommodating and pleasant. I have a GLUTEN intolerance. They even have several sauces that are gluten free as well. We ordered the Fire dragon roll, Salmon lollipop, Salmon sashimi, spy tuna, spy shimp we added cucumber and cilantro and a philly roll. All I have to say SUPER FRESH. We do sushi take out every Thursday and this will definitely be my new spot!!!
Great atmosphere! Sushi is always fresh, which is important to me. The staff are always friendly and eager to please. Happy hour specials are a must! Can't beat the prices for such great sushi!

First time eating at Pure was last night. Loved it. We met two other couples and really had a great time. The place was hoppin' when we got there -- good sign -- but it was easy to get a quick drink at the bar and the wait was only a few minutes. Our server, Jaymie, was fantastic. The Dragon roll was phenomenal, as were the other three rolls we had. Sushi and sashimi were very good, too. We split the butterfish -- it was over the top. I will be getting that every time. If you like great food, sushi and a fun place, we think you'll dig Pure.

Ordered two of their Sushi and Sashmi lunch combo with 5 pieces of Nigeri and sashimi.  The variety is great.  Sushi rice was a little too sweat and dry.  I can live with that.  What I couldn't live with was the slices of Tuna Sashimi in both orders had the white tendon in them.  Completely inedible.  Imagine trying to chew on a nice piece of Tuna wrapped in floss, that's what the experience was.  Fed the pieces I tried to chew to the dogs.  Shame was looking for another place to add to my weekly sushi fix, but going back to regular place.

We never got to eat because we left after waiting half an hour for our simple bento box lunch order and no one came to check on us or even refill our waters or even just say sorry taking a long time. Their lunch service is the worst. Never again.

Unfortunately we have given up on this place due to horrible costumer service. The sushi is decent. Our 4th unpleasant experience was when we called to place an order to go. We were put on hold for 6 minutes on a Monday night just like every time we call them. Last time they hung up on us. We ordered sushi and asked for extra ginger. When we got there, the waitress just handed me the bill. There was no extra ginger in the bag and when I asked for it, she responded with attitude "it should be in the box" and walked away. There are other places that you can get sushi and we really don't have to put up with their poor service.

This place is my go-to for happy hour sushi! $30 gets lunch/dinner for two, with a couple cocktails leaving us relatively full. We typically order 3-4 different rolls, gyoza, and the lettuce wraps.  The lettuce wraps are not what you typically see at PF Changs. I don't want to give away the secret, just order it.   The rolls are awesome, as well as the gyoza.   In fact, I have not found a single item on this menu that I do not love.

Had dinner with my wife and son on New Years Eve.  Place was not crowded yet dinner was not nearly as good as it used to be.  Lobster and Rainbow roll were small, chicken yaki soba was horrible.  Service lacked too.  Lots of other great choices in the area.
Pure Sushi was OK...but there are better places to get fish...

If I were to rate this place solely on the lunch bowls, I may have given 3 or 4 stars. They do put crab mix in both the Eel and Avocado bowl and Chirashi Bowl, which just honestly makes both dishes worse. Any dish or roll made of crab mix, which has absolutely no crab in it,  is worthy of only the trash can. I enjoy the Salmon and Avocado Bowl, but the Eel and Avocado and the Chirashi Bowls could both be improved by removing the crab mix and just adding an extra slice of non-mystery-meat fish.  One roll I ordered, which I would usually love from a quality sushi restaurant such as Hiro or Yasu Sushi Bistro, was a complete embarrassment. I got a softshell crab roll. One third of the ingredients were crab mix, which is low-quality fish marketed as imitation crab. It was possibly the worst 14 dollars spent in my life, and I bought several Tamagotchi, plenty of Pogs, and a lot of Pokemon cards back in my youth. I wish I knew where those cards were, but I also wish I could forget my food here. I could have gotten a better softshell crab roll at Teharu or Sushi Station for 3 or 4 dollars.  If I were a chef working here, I would be embarrassed and disappointed in the owner or creator of the menu.  Do a better job, and stop with the terrible American rolls disguised as Japanese sushi.  My name is Stirling Peters.

I ordered the Asian chicken salad and shrimp tempura - I'd give both a 5/10. The service was terrible - not once was I asked if I liked my food, if I needed anything else, if I needed a refill etc. none of the workers were very friendly - from the host to the server the customer service was poor.

Been here once. Sat at the bar for instant sushi. Very fresh and good quality. I wouldn't say that they are better than other places that I've tried. I love their sashimi salad. Not a big fan of their soup, too creamy. So I tried the udon soup, it is not that great, taste like water and not broth.
I have to wonder where such fresh fish comes from to Phoenix... Anyway, it was good. The food was good: not mind-blowing, just good.

Went here for Happy Hour at a friend's recommendation. Nice selection of good sushi at reasonable prices. It was a nice afternoon, so we sat outside on the patio. This made our service a little slower, but it was an enjoyable setting. It is in a corner location of a mall parking lot, so you have to put up with some cars and parking lot noise when on the patio.  Overall, good experience and plan to go back sometime soon.
Really enjoyed our dinner.  A great place for a romantic evening.  The Atlantic salmon entree is wonderful.  The sushi is also very good.

A great place to sit outside with friends. The lettuce wraps are phenomenal; the juicy crispness of the lettuce and the spicy, savory mayo are a perfect complement to the tuna. I highly recommend them.  Other dishes are good, but don't quite match the wraps awesomeness. The hoisin-tasting sauce on the Korean BBQ sliders doesn't really compute.
We ordered a ton of sushi, most from the happy hour menu and loved every sushi order! Definitely my new go to place for my sushi fix!

Loved it!  First timers here, we were looking for somewhere that is nice and not too high on the price range but just a great sushi spot and I have to say, Pure Sushi delivers.   The staff was great and really super nice and welcoming.  We never wanted for refills on our drinks and the prices were really affordable and the sushi, it was so YUMMY!    We had a couple regular rolls but also the Oktoberfest...TO DIE! This place delivers without a lot of the pomp and circumstance that is associated with many of the other sushi joints around and I can definitely see this being our new "go to".

Staff takes too long to get to the table especially if you are seated in the back room. Only happy hour prices are reasonable. Staff does not look happy.  Noisy. Hostesses inexperienced and not customer friendly.
Great happy hour prices! I had the calamari, edamame, and cali roll. All of them were delicious. They also came out very fast and I was very impressed with that. 10/10 will go again.

Yummy sushi & great miso soup! Good deals during happy hour! Decor is urban, modern and white. Service is always friendly and good! They have outdoor and indoor seating! Always a stop when we come to town!

I've never really been overwhelmed by the quality of sushi found in the Greater Phoenix area, but Pure changed all that for me this week!  I went for lunch and had the Sushi & Sashimi Platter.  It was perfect - delicious miso to start, just the right amount of food, outstanding quality and flavor of everything.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  I know I'll be back again soon.  The reason for no fifth star?  Even though the restaurant was virtually empty for our late lunch (2:00pm), we struggled several times to get our server's attention.  Disappointing, but easily overlooked considering the rest of the experience.

I won't lie, I wasn't impressed with Pure.  This is more like a 3.5 star review, I'm giving it a 4 because our server was great, my martini was well mixed and my wine was a generous pour.   Maybe I didn't have a great experience because we didn't order any specialty rolls?  The salad was creative but the edamame was awful.  Some were undercooked, some were overcooked and it wasn't salted enough. Honestly it may have been the worst edamame app I've ever had, the frozen stuff from TJ's that's been in my freezer for two months was better.  I didn't think the rolls were well rolled; several of mine fell apart. Its one thing when it's something huge like a specialty roll but an unagi roll or yellowtail scallion roll should be able to stay intact, especially with the seaweed on the outside.  The quality of the fish was great, but rather flavorless.    The atmosphere is fun and they have a large patio but I was shocked when our meal came to $100!

OMG!!!! I never get enough!!! This place is awesome!!! Their sushi is the best! Sushi is my favorite dish and have tried many places. I've never had anything better than here. I keep coming back!  And Asian pear is my favorite drink!!! I'm lucky I live 10 minutes from this location!

Great sushi and fun environment. About what you expect from Scottsdale neighborhood as far as the atmosphere and decor.   Had the Pure Vegas Roll and the October Fest Roll - AH-MA-ZING!  Highly recommend both. Our server was very nice (she recommended the October Fest and was spot on!).   I'll be back!

Let me say this before I begin: I'm not much of a sushi buff. I'll eat raw tuna until the sun comes up, but I'm not much for electric eel in zesty pepper sauces.  That being said, Pure is about as nice on the eyes as a sushi spot could be. Tucked away in a suburban shopping center in north Scottsdale, it looks unassuming enough from the outside, but the inside is über clean, modern and trendy like you'd expect for the Grayhawk area. The décor is excellent -- think a winter wonderland in the desert, with white and blue hues and a stunning bar. Most people go here to see and be seen, but the food is decent as well.  Get the toro, deliciously fattening tuna belly flesh with a zesty dipping sauce. Skip the non-sushi items on the menu. I got the salmon fillet and was very disappointed: dry, rubbery and salty, with not a hint of freshness.

Had not been here in 7 years and stopped in to get a carry out.  Had called ahead and Aubrey could not have been more accommodating.   She knew the menu well and was so very gracious while walking me through my smallish order. Sometimes it's the little things, yet Pure has been in this location for eons and having a front of the house special person like Aubrey makes the experience that more appealing
I thought the sushi was mediocre for the price they were charging.
I love this place me and my friend always comes and even when I'm near I'll come alone. I can never get enogh of the egg rolls. Always 5 star for every visit.

Our expectations for this pretty place in a strip mall up North weren't very high. On a beautiful October evening, we sat outside and started with spicy tuna lettuce wraps. Really terrific!  My husband's sushi included a hand-roll and everything made him extremely happy!  I tried the unusual type of bass over veggies and black rice and savored every bite. We truly enjoyed it all and can't wait to go back.
Awesome Happy Hour. And what's even better it HH 7 days a week! Yipeeee!
Really, really good sushi.  You must try the salmon bowl! Hubby loves the tuna bowl. Best in town!

In AZ for the holiday and we hit up this joint for dinner. Service was attentive  There hamasmi kama was the biggest I have ever had.and was taste the dipping sauce was lack luster.but doable Sushi was very average but fresh.  There salmon over leak was overcooked and dry. But in all it was a fine meal. I would go back if I was in the area and I ran out of Bologna at home. Biggest drawback.... Crown and water. It is ok to pour some Crown into the glass of ice and water..FYI I had a very nice water with a wave of crown. That my friends is a deal breaker for this cracker..

I moved here from California and was bummed because I had the assumption I would no longer be able to get good sushi in the desert (whether my assumption was correct or not it's just how I felt :P). But then my father took me to pure tonight and my sushi doom was over! It's just as good, if not better than any fancy sushi place I've ever been too. If you know good sushi then this place is definitely worth going too. If it's a little bit of a drive for you it's still worth it. Service was great, our sushi chef was really good and made sure we were well taken care of. All these great reviews can't be wrong right!

Our new Phoenix friends invited us to pure for their happy hour.  We arrived on a Friday night at 5 and the place was already busy.  We were a table of 6 and had a good server.  They have a great happy hour menu and we selected both hot and cold dishes.  Shrimp tempura, sliders and ribs were all very good.  Small selection of sushi on that menu but it was good.  Will come back and try the regular menu!
Really really good good and very cheap HAPPY hour I had the California roll and the Korean BBQ sliders. No regrets:) very good food and good service although my server seemed very flustered

Happy Hour at Pure Sushi is lovely..Asahi beer,pork sliders with crisp fries,taro with poke,calamari that are not greasey,and rolls,and a lot of other options.For a nice Saturday afternoon getaway this place can't be beat.fresh ingredients,professionals behind the counter and efficient service. We're here at a minimum of once a month. You won't be sorry you came.And if you are following a weekend game,multiple screens will keep you up to date re your team.

Wow. Wow. Wow. My Pure experience was awe-inspiring, and singular to be sure. Chrissy, Dottsy, Mike and I stopped by Pure (per the recommendation of my boss) on a Saturday evening at 645PM. The restaurant was nearly empty; apparently posh scottsdalites like to eat at 9PM. We slid into a booth just across from the chef's workspace and pondered the immense menu for a while. Our server was quick to greet us and get our drinks ordered while we decided. Finally, delusional from hunger, Mike whispered the magic words, sending Dottsy and I into ecstasy: chef's choice.   The Chef was feeling effusive that evening and we were quickly served a 2 foot long serving plate of sashimi loaded with halibut, octopus, tuna, scallop, and salmon. Everything was so fresh I swear I could see it twitching. Just moments later a *massive* platter arrived with six rolls.  I cannot remember the details of each roll, but suffice it to say everything was unique and perfectly crafted. I didn't use a single drop of soy sauce the whole night it was so delicious.   Somehow, after all that, we wanted more, and the chef brought out three more rolls, one of which was baked and topped with gorgeous mushrooms in a tangy sweet brown sauce. Our server commented that none of these rolls were on the menu, just something the chef thought up. We were also served dessert which we attempted halfheartedly, as we were now full to the brim on aquatic delicacies.   I didn't see the bill, so I can't speak to the pricing, but the meal was everything I could have dreamt of in a sushi feast, so for special occasions (those happen weekly, right?) I will definitely make my way back to Pure.

A very nice experience overall. The place is comfortable and clean. Our server was helpful and friendly. The menu is a good balance of mostly traditional American-style Japanese fare with some creative twists. The service was quick but nor rushed. There was an understanding of the multi-step, multi-course, deliberative nature of proper Japanese ordering. And, lastly, everything was fresh, with a good balance of flavors and served at just the right right temperate (for example, not too warm and not too cold for the sashimi). Highly recommend.

I really enjoyed my experience at Pure Sushi! We sat on the outdoor patio since it wasn't too cold (plus the heaters warmed us right up). We were dressed pretty casual, which I was a little nervous about when I got closer to the ultra modern, trendy decor but the service was fabulous! The In & Out Roll, I fell in love with and can't wait to have again. We also had the Lobster Roll and a few different types of sashimi- all were great! Next time I want to try the White Monster Roll. We also enjoyed some sake and The OC martini was great!! Definitely recommend Pure Sushi.

This is a great little neighborhood spot. On my last trip I had the Hokey Poke Roll and the King Crab Roll. Both had great flavor and I loved the spice of the Hoke Poke. We also had the sashimi platter which was fresh and tasty. Definitely recommend this place.

This is my favorite sushi spot in Scottsdale.  The sushi is second best to their great service.  Don't think that the sushi isn't fresh, creative and taste great.  The service is what keeps me coming back.  The environment you get is unlike any other and what they have created is genius.  Customers communicate with one another and the amazing staff makes it even easier to enjoy your time.   Today was another great experience from meeting great people like Edward and Brittany and them giving us great friend service. I say friend because I am not a customer at pure, I am always welcomed with a friendly hello and conversation.   They care about you and making your experience whether its just having a couple of drinks or a full on meal.   I truly appreciate great service and will always go to pure for the service alone ( but please keep making great sushi ).

I've been to Pure several times...but haven't been in a few months, and looking to try it out again.  Really enjoy the atmosphere...and food is really good...but I'm not so sure you can really screw sushi rolls up unless the fish is bad.  I can usually tell right away.  Friendly staff, kinda pricey!  I have a friend who used to work there and helped open the Oldtown location...during VIP night it was rockin'.  Free sushi and well drinks on them.  If you're going to open a restaurant that's the way to do it!
First time here and we have had sushi all over US.  This is definitely good sushi and our waitress Kelli made excellent recommendations.  Definitely will be back to have Crunchy roll and Fire Dragon!

Pure sushi is great for happy hour. Tuna and salmon rolls are only three dollars apiece and are on point. The rules are small in size but Two is really all you need. The indoor outdoor aspect of the restaurant is nice. There was a drunken man at the bar by himself when I was there, a little uncomfortable. Ate my sushi and bounced.

I've been a fan for at least 2 years now. Lucky I live near by too. This place is a diamond in the rough and almost as good as it get's. Love the modern, slightly contemporary atmosphere. The staff is wonderful and friendly. And since it's hard to screw up california rolls the best asset is ambience and sincere, friendly service. Therefore only a 4 out of 5 star rating: It couldn't hurt for the front lady to pull up a smile every now and then and at least pretend she cares about her customers.  The Sushi and Sashimi are awesome - the best I ever had. I love how they prepare it. Fresher than fresh. Any "non-toxic" or not "cooked to death" fish these days will be pricy. So if you're doing fish, raw or cooked - look out for wild caught not farmed and only the BEST.  The photo is nice but doesn't capture the "juice".

Good sushi and reasonable prices. Lots to choose from on the menu. Loved Happy Hour!  Only issue was sushi plates arriving all at once which meant a very crowded table. Nice ambience. Our server Kellie was awesome. Overall good experience.

First and so far only time I have ever ate sushi that I liked! I did order the teriyaki chicken and it was delightful! It's a cool ambience in the restaurant, kinda small but cozy! Our service was excellent, all the staff was really nice and really put together. I'll be back!

The food was amazing. The sushi options were very unique. We couldn't choose a favorite because they were all excellent. We had the Fire Dragon, Angry Caterpillar, Loch Nest, and Peppered Beef. All were very tasty and flavorful. We started with the Lobster Spring Rolls. Also an amazing dish. Best sushi in town.

Pure is such a Scottsdale high end sushi restaurant. All white posh decor. Small dining room inside with another room which must be private because I've never seen it being used. Bar area is very small, about 6 chairs able to fit at the bar and two small three high top tables. Patio area is nice, handful of booth seating outside to enjoy when the weather is nice.   Food is decent; nothing spectacular. Happy hour is your typical simple rolls like salmon, yellowtail, California etc for $3. Little fancier rolls for increased $6-8.   Service was okay. Had to hunt down server several times for water refill or to place an additional order.

Had a wonderful lunch. Fish was very fresh, the service was friendly and attentive, and the prices were on par with what you would expect.   There was a miserable wretched lady next to us wearing sunglasses inside throughout her entire lunch and she complained about EVERYTHING! She was yelling at the sushi chef and demeaning him because he didn't understand the fish names in Japanese (I believe he was Hispanic, what do you want?!?!). We were in shock watching this.   She finally went to the manager and complained several times. The manager had to take the poor chef to the back and reprimand him and give the wench a free lunch. My friends and I felt that this wasn't the first time this lady got a free lunch. The reason I brought this up is to stress how well the place handled a horrible customer. It's tough to keep your cool, but the chef did his job well and the manager got her out of the place quickly.   I'd go back any time.

Nah, yet another sushi place partly fusioned and a wanna be meat market in Snobsdale. I am sick of waiters and waitresses who don't have a pot to piss in and yet have narcissistic attitude.  They should not be in a service industry.  Even the sushi chef had the attitude of Japanese superiority complex. Hey chef, if you are so great, why did you emigrate from Japan?  It's a good thing I didn't go there with any of my clients or potential clients. They would have walked out and I would have lost my opportunity.  I want to be fair. The sushi was good to excellent. Price is not the highest but in the high range. If you can turn blind-eyes to all the goings against the people factor in this restaurant, then go there.  Just like anything else, it's the people that make or break the product and services. I hope this place comes to a real quick realisation of repositioning their attitude. For their services were worse than from people at fast foods restaurant.

Supposedly the best sushi place in Scottsdale -- and I must say, I have to definitely agree. Not sure if it's the absolute best (I'm still partial to my local fav's... Although a few more visits here may sway my vote), but it IS in my top 3! The sushi and sashimi is so fresh (and doesn't have that icky fishy smell like some sushi places) it literally melts in your mouth - so yummy! And the drinks (especially the pear martini) are absolutely phenomenal!!! (a must-have!)   I definitely recommend Pure -- it's a great place for sushi with a wonderful atmosphere, friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff, and amazing happy hour prices -- I will be back for round two! :)
This is my overall best place to enjoy sushi. Clean, great staff, the best happy hour ever! Wonderful outside patio, fun bar area and nice sushi bar seating. You cannot go wrong going to Pure!

We had such a great private graduation party last night at Pure Sushi!! Phil was so great and easy to work with, even over the phone. Our waitress Rochelle was amazing. Wonderful evening. Pure Sushi made it a very special night in the white room!!
Service was excellent.  We are from the Boston area and come back on an annual basis.  Very happy with this visit!  The food was great and the waitress offered suggestions that we loved.

I love this place for a cool miami feel for sushi. The pear martini is great as well as the sashimi. I enjoy the scenery and ambiance of this place because it is very open and inviting. The lollipop rolls are also very good if you're looking for something healthy.

Great sushi place.  Went with some out of town friends. They were hesitant at first because they didn't relate Phoenix with good sushi. They left happy and with changed minds. We shared several rolls, the names escape me now. I love their iced green tea. It actually had flavor, the best green tea I ever had. I will return here soon with my local sushi eaters.
I LOVE this place!  Amazing happy hour specials!  Service is fantastic and the food is always exceptional and the patio is great for a nice evening dinner.

Went here for my birthday.  From the moment we walked in, I wasn't all that impressed.  Sure the decor and ambiance  is nice, but I think this is a place where people go "to be seen".  The tables are so close together that people kept bumping into my husband's chair as they walked by and when I was getting into my seat, my butt was pretty much on the table next to us.  The sushi was nothing to brag about and the rolls kept falling apart.  My husband had finished his beer well before we finished our meal and the server never asked him if he wanted another beverage.  Won't be back.

Sooooooooooo....a good friend of mine took me here for Happy Hour to celebrate my birthday. Uhhh...after 15 years of friendship, how could she forget that I HATE Fish (Yes, all types of Fish!)  I had to scroll to the appetizer list and there it was --  Sliders: Pulled Pork with our famous Korean BBQ sauce, served with Cole Slaw and spicy mixed Frites. These were delish. I had two of this appetizer and was completely happy. I like that there are enough choices for me to consider on my next visit back. Cheers***

My boyfriend and I had our first date here a few years ago and decided to go back recently to celebrate his birthday. The sushi was very expensive, but it was good.  We had some salmon sashimi, a spicy shrimp roll and a shiromi lovers roll that had asparagus, crab and halibut. Its was all really good, especially the spicy shrimp. After all this we were still hungry for more and ordered the fire dragon roll- spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, fresh tuna on top sprinkled with cilantro and diced jalapenos- Awesome! Loved it!  It was expensive but it was worth it!

I want to immediately say the sushi here is 4 start quality, maybe 4.5.  It's always fresh and if you know what you like, the presentations and flavors really are above average.  Honestly, when we have visitors in town, I recommend this place because the quality is great and I know that's what a sushi lover cares about most!    So, why only a 3 start rating?  Plain and simple - quality of service.  The staff here is by far the least knowledgeable about sushi that I have every experienced.  It's clear they all want to be there because sushi is expensive and that's how tips get bigger.  Bartenders are completely uninformed about sake, which should always be an easy sell with sushi.  I had a server ask me to cash out in the middle of a meal once so she could go pick up her kid.  Just in case the managers care to read these reviews, a complaint like this should always come with some advice.  A better way to handle a server leaving in the middle of a meal is to transfer the check and let them collect all or part of the tip the next day.  Share some knowledge with the staff about the ingredients in the kitchen and why customers should love the product.  I could go on, but I'd rather focus on the food.  The chefs get it.  All of the plates look beautiful.  They have a high quality product and are proud to present it.  I wish there was a place on the bill to designate the entire tip to the back of the house.  Great sushi.  Always fresh.

This place doesn't disappoint.  Their food is always delicious - which continues to surprise coming from living by the ocean. Hooowwww dooo theyyyy do it?! They have a private patio with TV's (if you are sports fans), and the bar inside is an awesome place to wait if you called in a to-go order -- which we do more than I'd like to admit.  Attentive staff, and an incredible HH that is a must-try.

We sat at the sushi bar and I wanted a roll with salmon but didn't want any rice and wasn't in the mood for a hand roll so the sushi chef, Eddie, recommended the Loch Ness salmon roll. OMG! It was so delicious and fresh! They have this Scottish salmon that's so buttery and with the siracha and Asian pesto sauce, I have to say it was one of the best rolls I've had. No rice means I can eat it all and have room for more yumminess. Eddie took the time to make the roll to perfection and appreciated it. Well worth the wait! Will be back!

Went early about 6pm.  Clean and neat place, nice deco.  Service was great, server quick and friendly.  Food though was very average.  Good but nothing special.  I would go here again but it isn't my first choice.
Love love love Pure! Hands down my fave sushi in the area, and their happy hour rocks!

A great place for lunch with a very modern  and chic interiorwhich is always pleasing - a great place for a business lunch too! I always have the bento boxes which have a little bit of everything in a good combo. The tempura is exceptional too. Nice to know that it's so close to home too!! YAY!

I have been to this place twice and waited to write a review until my second time.   To be honest, the first time we went (was during HH), we thoroughly enjoyed their food and we had their Gyoza, edamame, spicy tuna roll, Fire Dragon roll and some other special roll they had.  Sushi was very good and so were the apps.  Our problem though was the service.  We were greeted and asked if we wanted water "or anything", which was odd but we ordered a few cocktails and apps that were on HH.  The drinks took fairly long to get and actually our edamame came out before we got our drinks!  It was 5:30 when we ordered our other food so well within the HH window.  We got our food shortly thereafter and the waitress did not come by until we were almost finished with our last roll!  I ordered another drink on HH but she forgot it and then came back and asked if I still wanted it since it was not going to be on HH (she rung it in too late).  I did not feel like fighting with her so I refused the drink, with no apology from her about the mix up.  We were disappointed with the service but we really liked the food so we thought we would wait a few weeks and come back.  The second time, both the food and the service was bad!  We ordered virtually the same thing but got a rainbow roll instead of one of the other rolls during HH.  Again, edamame came out before our drinks.  I do not know if the avocado on the rainbow roll was bad or what, but it was brown and unappetizing.  The yellowtail also had a brown tinge to it.  When we asked the server if it is normal, she said the yellowtail can look like that at times because all fish is different... weird.  But she did say the avocado looked old but is probably still good.... weird again.  Needless to say, we tried pieces with salmon on top and low and behold, the seaweed was chewy -- almost as if it had gone bad.  We did not finish it.  Good old trustworthy spicy tuna roll may help matters.... nope.   Chewy seaweed again.  Fire Dragon roll = chewy seaweed.  The waitress said that is normal.  So, frustrated with the service here again and not in the mood to complain or waste any energy, we ate our Gyozas and edamame and requested the check. Although we ate two bites of the Rainbow Roll and we said we didn't like it, we were still charged.  If it cost anything more than $4, I would have said something.  However, the service was just as bad so not sure anything would have been done about it.    We definitely will not be going back here.  That same night, we went to Local Bistro right next door for dessert (we were going to have some at PURE and we were still hungry) and we had the best service.  Needles to say, that restaurant was packed at this time and PURE was only about a quarter full.  Does that tell you something? With the three other restaurants within walking distance of this restaurant, I would hope this place would have higher expectations for their service and food.

I've gone to many sushi places and we stopped here as its close to home.  The sushi was not top rated as many reviews have posted.  It didn't go over the top or offer anything unique.  Its super expensive sushi.  We can go else where in the valley and get better.

I dined at this amazing place on Sunday the last day of Restaurant Week - AZ. They put together an amazing menu that was really worth the cost.  Started with Miso Soup - perfect! Second had the Ahi Poke - which was prepared on these little triangles of what seemed like a soft corn tortilla. I could not figure out exactly what it was - and doesn't matter - all I know was Yummo! Next course was Sea Bass - prepared to perfection. Not too much flavor as to distract - but just enough.  Last was the roll dessert - with cream, berries and a sweet rice - I was in heaven.  All that and an amazing bottle of wine that was half off - sitting outside under the misters at a nice 90 degrees - in Beautiful AZ - who could ask for more?
Nice place to enjoy happy hour and relax in a cool atmosphere.  The pear martini was well made and very good.  The bartender was friendly and made great drinks!

* Update - I gave it another chance.  Service is still a bit slow near the end of your meal but overall,  it was much, much better.  Keep making sure that Tuna stays fresh and I may keep coming back.   (Previous post, now updated ) - Like one poster said,  unfortunately this restaurant has suffered in the last couple of years.

I must say this place has gone down hill, it used to be amazing! Walking in the door my daughter and I stood there for quite some time. The place was not busy due to the holiday weekend .The hostess looked at us  Never greeted us with a hello or a smile !! .  I was unclear if this girl even work here. I finally took it upon myself to sit myself and my daughter at the sushi bar she then walked over with menus. I have been in the hospitality industry all my life this is not someone I would have representing my restaurant. Looking around it looked very j unorganized and unclean. The fish did not look fresh which is presented in a case in front of you at the sushi bar.!!! I don't know call me crazy usually when you go to a sushi bar the chefs are very friendly and knowledgeable about different roles and specials they offer, this never occurred in this place. I don't recommend it I've eaten out many different places I will not be going back or recommending to anyone!!!!!!!

Pure has some damn good sushi. We had a lot of standard rolls that didn't have a particular "wow" factor to them, but the fish was delicious.   The place itself, however, is totally -not- my style. Uberhip white everything with a wall made out of giant letters (the first thought that came into my head was "I really want to climb into that 'R.'") and flatscreen TVs. Oh, and poorly-designed restrooms (petty complaint, but still a pet peeve of mind). I'd like to come back... maybe during the day it will be less... uh...weird.   And... charging for edamame and miso soup? Really? Come on. Service was spotty, but our waiter did make an effort to apologize for any delays, so that was appreciated.
The sushi roll I got was very good. The BBQ Pork Ribs were AMAZING! Loved the sauce. The server was great too.

If your cheap don't eat here!  Expensive is good when it comes to putting raw fish in your mouth in the middle of the desert.  The sushi here is quality to the point that if I had no clue where I was in the US, and was served what I ate here last night, I'd have to say Hawaii or NYC.  That's a huge compliment considering how hard it must be to source fresh fish in AZ.  The tempura was great, the sashimi was awesome, and washing it all down with some sake and beer, made the blow of a big bill palatable.  Sushi is alive and well in the desert, and Pure is a great example of how to do it right.

Yelp gives Pure Sushi two $$ but I think it is closer to three $$$. The sushi was good, but I thought it was a little pricey, especially the alcoholic drinks. Other than that, great service and a nice atmosphere.
This place has a good happy hour and the sushi/food is pretty good!

They do serve nice Lunch Bento Boxes SEVEN DAYS a week priced $11-18.  I had the salmon teriyaki lunch bento box ($13) that included an oriental sauced side mix green salad,steamed rice,one large tempura shrimp and tempura vegetables (two big pieces of sweet potato, one zucchini,one onion ring) My salmon was tasty and a perfect size for lunch,not only did I get all that food I mentioned but my salmon was on top of pan seared mixed vegetables including baby bok choy.   Service was especially good from our server and the manager.

Some of my friends have been bragging about this place and I was really excited when my Sushi group decided to have a meet up there.  I was not disappointed!  I ordered the famous Creamy Baked Lobster Roll, Happy Hour Philly Roll and the Pure Crunch Roll.  All were very good and the service was superb, the manager noticed an item on the table wasn't right and took the initative to correct it without being asked to.  The food was out quickly and accurately, and the waitress was on top of everything, I never saw the bottom of my water glass.
Bad food, bad service. Honestly, the sushi even SMELLED bad. Super expensive given mediocre quality.  I live in the neighborhood, have eaten there several times. Always the same...I give up.  AVOID!!

I am a big fan of the Old Town location but this one is closer to my house so I decided to give it a try. I didn't like it very much because the clientele here is older and stuffy and tall the tables were really small and close together.  We decided to get the fire dragon roll, white monster roll, and baked lobster roll.  I tried the dragon roll first and it was really spicy but tasty, the white monster roll was forgettable I wouldn't recommend it,  the baked lobster roll came last and was the best out of the three rolls we tried.  I like the Old Town location better because it's bigger and I feel more comfortable ordering sake bombers when I'm not surrounded but a whole bunch of old people.

We went here due to recommendations for others. The sushi was ok. Most of the specialty rolls had shrimp tempura which was a little disappointing. And the rice in the sushi was somewhat soggy. However my husband ordered the grilled salmon entree and the fish was delicious!

Kristen, you really stunk up a rather lovely group lunch with a poor attitude. Perhaps you were swamped with tables and stressed out, i don't know, but it definitely wasn't our fault. And yet it felt like we were to blame for well, most everything.  We couldn't order hot tea because 'there weren't any pots (for the tea) and everybody is drinking green tea'. Yet the very next person in our group asked about coffee and that wasn't a problem. Forgive me - but couldn't the green tea be put into a coffee cup (or miso soup bowl for that matter)? I'm not a rocket scientist, nor do i play one on tv but...  And the snippy remarks just kept coming! At every visit. I've never had a waitress come to the table, get one or two typical requests for an extra sauce or another soda and then ask the rest of the table: "Anyone else need anything? 'Cause once I'm gone, I'm not coming back..."   Our group had 7 people. You and another waitress brought out nine plates of food, six lunches and three plates of sushi and when one of us wasn't served their lunch, because of the plate arrangement it may have looked like they were served, so they inquired.. "Um, my lunch?" Your full response was promptly forgotten after the words "Well, we only have so many arms!"  The person who signed for the lunch may have tipped you well but i would have tipped you to find another job, one definitely *not* in the service industry...   BTW: Food was good but it really sucked that we were insulted and / or mistreated every time you came to the table. {I hope you have a better day, because this clearly wasn't a good one.}
Good food but a bit pricey. I have ate lunch there a dozen or so times. Alway good.

This gem of a restaurant is as good as many Japanese restaurants that charge double or triple the price. The sushi is as fresh as I have eaten in the best places, and the Salmon Teriyaki and vegetables are made to perfection. This place is a winner!
Best sushi I've ever had. Ate here in September and then again last night....this place is super awesome.
Love your food but unfortunately as of late your service has suffered. Very slow drink service and waitress has lost orders and basically abandoned our table

Our waitress Kellie made this place worth the drive to N. Scottsdale! We were in town for a girls trip and took a cab for sushi thinking it would be a quick trip but it was a $50 cab ride. After just mentioning this to her she took complete care of us and went out of her way to make sure we were happy. The sushi was really good but we kept it to simple rolls also. The happy hour menu was PERFECT for this and the price during happy hour CAN NOT be beat! Kellie gave us some reccomendations and areas to go and places to check out for our girls trip and she was right on with those as well. Every staff member we were introduced to gave us their opinions as well and were very helpful!   Love this place and would make the drive to come back the next time I visit, Just not via cab from ASU. :)
