My dad and I frequent this place often when we have lunch together.  The staff has been unfailingly nice, the prices are mid-range but the quality is great.  The lunch / happy hour specials rock socks.

3 stars mostly because I expected a sushi restaurant when I made the reservation due to the name, but it's really more a Japanese Fusion place. Food was good, drinks were good, atmosphere a little isolated and cold. If you are looking for trendy Japanese fusion this is the place, if you want good sushi go elsewhere. Sushi is basically a artistic appetizer here not a meal. I did get their sushi platter (because I came for sushi) and it was just not right. Lots of cooked items, not enough true sushi.

The sushi was good not great.  I have dined here before on many occasions.   The issue is the staff.  They should listen to the guest more and get the details right.  I ordered a large order of sushi to go.  I was staying at a hotel.  I checked my order receipt while I was waiting and the order was wrong.  Items were forgotten.  Once I did receive my order to go the extra items requested were missing so I had to go back and ask for additional chop sticks, soy sauce etc.  I had requested these items twice.  The staff tends to converse more with the locals that come in and not give attention to the other guests.

I'd give this a 3.5 if possible. The sushi was pretty good but I thought the lollipop roll was a little bland. I really liked the Pure sunshine roll, the negi hamachi, and assorted nigiri. The ahi avocado poke app was very good. We were hoping to have a few more options of specialty rolls that weren't tempura style or with cream cheese. It was nice to be able to get in easily at 8 on a Friday night.
Always a great spot!  We go here often.  Patio is wonderful during the spring.  Poke is amazing, their happy hour rocks.

Made reservation for a Friday at 5.45.  Arrived on time and our table was ready.  Good thing we had res---place was PACKED with Happy Hour people!!!!  Waitress dropped by table to say she would be "right with us" about four times, but we did not give our drink and appy orders until about 6.10.  Happily, waitress said she'd make sure we got the HH pricing.  It took about 20 minutes to get our drinks, another 15 for food.  We almost got irritated enough to bail, but then were convinced to stay---thank goodness we did.  As HH crowd cleared, service improved IMMENSELY. And food---quality and quantities rocked!  DS and I each started with avocado and ahi poke ($7).  HUGE portions.  Six poke laden chips on a narrow 12 inch platter...we could easily have shared, but son and I each managed to dispose of our share.  DH got the tempura fried shrimp ($4).  Five 4-5 inch shrimp perfectly encrusted in a light, crisp tempura with a yummy dipping sauce.  The four of us all had the miso soup, which was okay, but I like Yume's better.  Personal taste.  For entree, DH got the chicken teriyaki, which he said was "f'ing-tastic".  (Language!)  DS got the creamy baked lobster roll, spicy tuna roll, and fire dragon roll.  DSG got two vegetable rolls.  I got the sashimi platter with 5 different fish.  Huge quantities, everything so fresh and delicious and beautifully presented.  As I said, our service was much improved once HH crowd dispersed.  Ambiance was hipster and VERY loud.  Wish we had dined on the patio, which seemed quieter.  DH and I can't return.  I want to try the citrus-basil martini with the ahi poke while sitting on the patio on a quiet Sunday afternoon.  I just know that would be great!

Wow!  Best sushi I have had in a while.    I went here with 4 colleagues after a round of golf at GrayHawk down the street.  We were seated promptly and the staff was super friendly.    We had close to 15 different rolls, some wine, and sake.   It was the best dinner of our trip and can't stop thinking of how good it was.  Highly recommend this place.

Party of seven arrived 10 minutes before happy hour ended. They were gracious and kind offering us happy hour. We ordered off both menus. All the food was first class! A few minor service flaws that I noticed but don't think my party did. All in all a great restaurant with very friendly, outgoing staff. Definitely will return! I love walking into a restaurant and seeing the staff smiling!

I recently came to Pure Sushi for dinner and was very impressed with the experience! It had been a while since I had been in, and the atmosphere is sleek and sophisticated. The entire menu is extensive but not overwhelming. I ordered the Chirashi Bowl and it was AMAZING! It was perfect for someone who doesn't know what to order and wants a variety of fresh fish.  There was literally at least 20 pieces of fish on a bed of rice for $20! They had everything I wanted, octopus, salmon, tuna, and so many others I can't remember. The bartender, Cass was super friendly and provided great service. My friend ordered a Chirashi Bowl as well but did not want certain fish and they were super accommodating as well. Will be back!
Best happy hour in town and the sushi is fresh and tastes delicious!  One of our favorite spots!

Okay, the food is really a 5 star experience, personally the best sushi I have ever had!  The reason I can only give this place 4 stars, the service...it's just way  too slow!  How long does it really take to go to Japan and back with your order??!!! WTF?  We had the In and Out roll, seaweed salad, Spicy tuna roll, and the Chicken Lo Mein noodles.  YUM-O, it was all absolutely delicious, beautiful presentation.  My favorite was the In and Out roll- crab, shrimp, asparagus, cucumber, avocado, tempura exterior and eel sauce-AMAZING!!!  We sat on the patio which was pretty nice, but it started to get a little cool so we attempted to turn on the gas lamp, it was not working so we asked for help and they were dumb founded!  We were told they would send someone out and it never happened.    If you are diabetic, you just may want to pack a snack if you come here, it's gonna be awhile before you get your meal and you just might pass out from low blood sugar!

I cannot believe that I have never written a review of this place considering how many times we have been here. Great service, the food is really good. Fresh sushi. Fantastic happy hour. Highly recommend.
Best Sushi in Scottsdale...  We go here once, sometimes two or three times a month...  They have some of the best rolls ever, try the Vegas Roll or the Peppered Steak Roll, but don't stop there!
Three of us enjoyed our rolls and sushi( no spicy sauce) we'll be back for more fresh fish.

Pure has a fabulous happy hour! The Yellowfin Ahi and Avocado Poke appetizer is a must get. The sweet potato fries that come with the sliders are also great. Both rolls we ordered (pure crunch roll & fire dragon roll) have been my favorite that I've had so far in Scottsdale. Prices are amazing & they have HH 7 days a week.

Great Sushi - Just moved here from LA and it took a few times to find a sushi place to love. My Favorites are the Lollipop rolls, which are rolled in cucumber instead of rice and the King Crab roll.   Love it!

We had so many happy hour rolls and they were all so tasty. The tempura shrimp roll was my favorite with the eel sauce. The spicy tuna and the salmon rolls were tasty too. Great service and very clean restaurant.
Unbelievably delicious! Fabulous service. Best Asian pear martini you could ever dream of having, Quite a gem of a place. Enjoy the out of this world happy hour

I'm on the fence about Pure Sushi. We did have a good visit, the waitress was pleasant. Service was good, but not exceptional, nor terrible either.   We came mainly for the happy hour menu, and the soft shell crab we saw on Yelp. They no longer have soft shell crab as a regular item, but were able to give us the soft shell crab with a nice baby green salad for $14. I can say $14 is a little steep for any soft shell crab and should be executed perfectly for that price. I would say at best this crab was $8 soft shell crab. The batter was a little heavy hiding the true deliciousness of it.   The happy hour items were surprisingly decent for their prices, and would probably only recommend this place if you are coming for their happy hour. The Korean BBQ Pork Ribs were delicious. I found the Sliders a little too sweet and over sauced (both came with huge piles of shoestring fries, we preferred the sweet potato ones to the regular ones).   The Pure Crunch roll was good, but not exceptional; we preferred the creamy baked lobster roll. The edamame was good. The Shrimp tempura was good, but only included three pieces with a giant bowl of sauce (I'm really not sure why they give so much sauce for so few shrimp).   We also ordered two peach iced teas, which were good, but completely unsweetened. The bill came to about $50 before tip. The softshell crab definitely brought the price up, otherwise it would be a fairly reasonable meal.   The main reason I'm giving this place three stars is that nothing really stood out as exceptional and that the regular menu is a well a little overpriced. As I said, only come for happy hour!

One of our go-to happy hour spots. But they've been sliding downhill a bit. Slashed weekend happy hours. Out of several favorite wines by the glass & surprisingly. a few other things. Stopped carrying Fave Sculpin IPA on draft & servers never seem to know what is on tap. Servers spotty- several very personable, some quite the opposite. That's making it easier to get a table now.

Pure is a good staple in my lunch portfolio.  I don't go here for everyday lunches with the usual work crew, but it is perfect for business lunches where you are looking for good atmosphere and somewhere you won't be rushed, or catching up with old friends in an out-of-the-way area.    I really enjoy the beno boxes, highly recommend the salmon teriyaki version--the value is actually pretty good for the amount of food you get.  I definitely leave more satisfied vs. a typical sushi lunch.

The desire for sushi overcame us on our stay in Scottsdale so the 4 Star Yelp ratings convinced us to try it.  The restaurant is very pretty inside very modern with uncomfortable chairs.  I love eel and soft shell crab and both were on the menu.  We picked out what we wanted and almost instantly our orders began to arrive.  I grabbed the eel first and I was a bit disappointed,it was overly fishy and seemed like it was old.  The soft shell crab was ok,but nothing to write home about.  The spicy tuna roll just ok. All in all the service was good,the sushi mediocre.

My boyfriend and I walked in last Sunday after I finished work, about 1:30. It was pretty empty which was nice. They have happy hour, which I didn't know from 11-6. It was awesome. We had a great meal and the bill was half of what we usually spend! By the way, the lollipop roll was AMAZING! As was everything else!

This was our first visit to this restaurant. We have eaten at other nearby restaurants and has wanted to check it out. After reading many of the Yelp reviews, we decided to go.   The restaurant has a great atmosphere and nice decor. The staff was friendly and prompt. We felt that the sushi rolls were over priced and that many of the sushi pieces were small in size.   On a positive note, I also ordered the Shrimp/Tuna Sushi Bowl. It was delicious and beautifully arranged. I've included a picture of the bowl. I'd visit again and order the same bowl.

I really enjoyed my sushi lunch. The salmon was the right temp. I don't like my sushi very cold. I ordered a cucumber martini and it was delicious. Service was very good. I also ordered the Fire Dragon Rolls and I will order it again. Just the right amount of spiciness for me. I am looking forward to returning with my hubby for happy hour. The only issue i had was the high top bar table I was at was sticky and there was rice on one of the chairs.

My family LOVES Pure.  They have a good happy hour and have always have great food.  My 7 year old son asks to go all the time.  We have also had multiple birthday reservations in the back room and had great experiences.

We've been going to this place for a while. Food is excellent & staff friendly & helpful. On a recent visit we were given a table in a two- table private room. We were soon joined by a group of abusive, drunken near do wells - the kind only Scottsdale can produce. The management was unwilling to do much about this & an excruciating remainder of supper followed. Upon leaving we noted our experience and disappointment; the manager basically denied the event & offered only a half-hearted apology - nothing else! What kind of customer service is this?   Avoid this place. Really avoid this place.

This place has great sushi and service is very good. Great happy hour specials! My only complaint is the seating. They really need to change the seats to something other than cloth. The seats are absolutely disgusting and have food stains all over them. A restaurant should not have cloth seating. Please change this and I would give it 5 starts!

** If you are a parent that thinks it is acceptable to allow your child to run amuck, please stop reading now **  I really like sushi.  I love sitting at the sushi bar, enjoying some good food and conversation.  So, when my friend suggested that we go to Pure I was looking forward to trying this new-to-me sushi spot.  What can go wrong?  A lot.  Upon arrival we were seated at the sushi bar, and immediately noticed that a boy around the age of 10 was seated alone next to us.  I wondered where his parents were (this was at night, and I thought it was strange to leave a child alone where liquor was being served), but really didn't think it would be an issue.  Mistake.  It quickly became obvious that he could not be unsupervised.  Disruptive.  Food everywhere.  Impossible to ignore.  I am not exaggerating.  Ick.  This is not McDonalds - where are his parents!?  My friend mentions this to our waitress not once, but twice.  This is when I expect one of two things to occur:   1) we would be offered different seating, or 2) a manager would ask the parents (who I realized were dining separately at the complete other end of the sushi bar - WTF?) to bring him to sit with them so as not to disturb others.  Neither of these things happened.   In the meantime, we have a pear martini (excellent), yellowtail sashimi (OK, not great) and attempted to enjoy a crabcake (blegh).  It was not fresh at all.  It tasted metallic.  Inedible.  I know what crab should taste like, and this isn't it.    Back to our young diner - my friend, realizing that this kid is a nightmare, approaches the parents to explain the situation.  Why did he have to do this?  Because nobody on the Pure staff would step up to deal with it.  At this point I am very irritated (and hungry!).  Oh, it gets better.  My exasperation is interpreted by my friend as annoyance or maybe embarrassment that he spoke with the kid's parents.  No, no, no.  I cannot explain this for some reason and now everyone is aggravated.  Oh joy.  The waitress chooses this moment to offer to bring us something else to replace the crabcake, but I was pretty much over the whole experience at that point.  Scary kid, creepy food, my friend is annoyed with me and I really just want to leave.  I cannot get my credit card out quickly enough.  Get me out of here - that year-old hot pocket that is lingering somewhere in the back of my freezer is sounding pretty good right now.  Our waitress was extremely apologetic, and didn't charge me which I thought was nice (thus additional star).  However, some things you can't make up for.  Pure, you left a bad taste in my mouth.

Great Sushi...best I've had in Phoenix.  The cost was fairly significant, but the taste was worth it.  The service also left something to be desired (even sitting at the bar).  I'd go back again on a special occasion.

The food wasn't that good. I ordered a bloody mary which was not drinkable so i left without drinking it and nobody asked if it was okay or why i didnt drink it or if i wanted something else. Same story with the food - no one asked if we enjoyed the food or if everything was okay. Overall the customer service was terrible. I would rank the sushi a 5/10. You would at least think they would be more friendly when you're spending $100 on sushi for two people.
Real nice place very modern not as authentic as some of the sushi. The fish is outstanding!

Took the family for happy hour. They have the best prices and decent quality. Full salmon rolls for $3 HH prices. My kids ate 5 of them. Reminds us of Stingray and since their Scottsdale Quarter location closed this will replace it. Not the closest to home but well worth it. All day HH on Sunday too. Can't beat it.

Good sushi, delicious Japanese noodles, and an interesting cocktail menu. Come here for the food and enjoy the atmosphere. It's a bit pricey if you're just looking for a sushi restaurant, but once you're inside, you'll see why you're paying a bit more than a local sushi joint.

Was here for NYE and my birthday celebration, bf explained it was my bday upon making reservation.  It was a little more casual than expected but that was fine.  Server Laura, with long blonde hair and big silver circle earrings took her time getting us started.  We ordered a bottle of champagne on the menu and she said I don't know if we have that.  Then she proceeded to flip through our menu on the table to see what they had, clearly unfamiliar with their offerings.  Hmm. NYE you would think you would know what bubbly you have..just sayin'.....She then brought a tiny bottle of sparkling sake and my bf politely asked, "Um, is that champagne?"  She looked at it then realizing her mistake, rushed off to get what we ordered and said it was my mistake and the bar's.  We started with a tuna and poke appetizer which was good, it had truffle oil and served on tortilla chips which was a nice crunchy contrast.  The sauce was really sweet and almost too much as you could barely taste the truffle oil even though you could smell it.  Next the tuna in the spicy tuna roll was brown(?) and not spicy, must have been with a mild soy sauce, and accompanied by only cucumber inside.  This was my least favorite.  The rainbow roll was good and what we expected, albacore sashimi was good but not the best I have had.  Sunshine roll had tuna with a mango sauce that was a refreshing fruit sauce to the palate since most of our rolls were sweet, salty, and or creamy/rich.  The baked scallop roll was okay, too much mayo in the overcooked scallops and was drenched in eel sauce.  The creamy baked lobster roll was the best, with lobster tempura on top of the roll with eel sauce.  Lobster was cooked just right.    I really wanted a lava cake for my bday but she said they were out which was disappointingly surprising since it was early, like 9:30 ish.  So we said we didn't need anything else (code for "you can bring the check")  but still waited for the bill. No luck so I put my coat on as a hint. Still nothing so we started looking around as a sign and even had bf put his bright red debit on the table for her to see...still waiting.  Finally had bf take his card to her.  Sub par service considering the restaurant was not even full and she clearly wasn't busy.  Food was good but not memorable.  Service below average and unlikely to return.  She never even wished me happy birthday.
First time having sushi in the desert I was a little worried! I was surprised! Great chefs super fun atmosphere and great food! I'll come back

Pure is all about ambiance. Sushi "purists" will look elsewhere. The decor is modern, trendy and Scottsdale scene-esque. The food is decent (yet pricey) but if you're looking for authenticity and quality you'll need to go somewhere that doesn't invest all their money into the non-edible stuff.

Love everything about this place - the ambiance, the service and freshness of the food. All three times I've been here I've experienced consistency, which is very important for me.  You can't go wrong with their bento lunch boxes. I've had the beef and chicken, and they're both so sooo good and very well-served.  Their prices are reasonable considering you're getting the whole package - fresh food, great portions, good service and a nice location.  Definitely my favorite sushi place in the valley.

I have eaten at Pure Sushi several times, mostly the Happy Hour menu which is a real bargain.  However, decided to try new items and wow, how about the seaweed salad and baked yellow tail cheeks.  The shrimp tempura is excellent.  Can't go wrong eating there.  YUM!

Ric's Body & Paint crew & myself would like to give a HUGE shout out to Pure Sushi!! This sushi is the best in the valley! We had two large trays of varieties of sushi and not one bite was left over! The Sushi was fresh, well made and delicious! This will definitely be our Go-To sushi place. Thank you so much Phil!  -Ric's Body & Paint

This was my first time eating at Pure Sushi. Since I live close, thought I'd give it a shot. First, the hostess acted like I was putting her out when I asked to be seated at the sushi bar. She also did not give me a happy hour menu/order sheet. The waitress was helpful in getting me the right menu and was attentive throughout my visit. I ordered a spicy yellowtail roll and a dragon roll. The dragon roll was ok, nothing great. The yellowtail tasted very fishy. Sushi here is definitely not fresh and actually made me horribly sick for two days. If I decide to ever eat sushi again after that experience, I'll go back to Sushi Brokers or Sumo Maya.

Simply: amazing.  Blown away by absolutely we ordered, there was nothing we didn't enjoy. The uni here is ESPECIALLY delicious - probably the best I've had to date (I'm drooling now just thinking about it!)   Sitting at the sushi bar also provided us with some personal recommendations from the chefs, and some entertaining conversation. The chefs were incredibly personable, and well educated on their sushi.  Highly, HIGHLY recommended!

Midweek dinner.  Convenient location and nice outdoor seating area (hello, it's Scottsdale) with heaters for shoulder season.  Or off season. But, I digress.   Not very busy on a Tuesday, so we were seated immediately.  We chose outside, not that it matters to the review.  But maybe a bit.    We ordered miso soup and edamame (yes, I know, how cliche) for our first course, and then an assortment of nigiri, including unagi and an unagi roll.  The only reason for going into such detail is that the unagi is served hot/warm.    Here is the reason this is four stars -- they brought all of our food in about a one minute window.  It came out fast.  Very fast.  But in reality, too fast.    As for quality -- very interesting take on miso soup -- but good.  And all of the fish was fresh and very good.  Except for the pacing (or failure at it), the service was outstanding.

I love this place! The location is super close to both work/home and they have a great happy hour. My husband and I have been a few times and even brought both sets on in-laws. Everyone agreed how delicious it was and we can't wait to come back.   As for sushi, we have tried the Rainbow Roll ($5HH), Pure Crunch Roll ($5HH), and Fire Dragon Roll ($6HH). The Fire Dragon Roll has to be my favorite with shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, cucumbers, jalapenos, and spicy poke sauce. Every time I order it, I wish I had ordered more since everyone likes it so much. I would highly recommend it!  We have tried almost all of their appetizers. The edamame ($1.5HH) were so delicious we had to order three of them. The pork gyoza ($3HH) are amazing and come with a tasty dipping sauce. The shrimp tempura ($4HH) are good but you only get three - which aren't really a great HH deal. The sliders ($4) are delicious - pulled pork with Korean BBQ sauce and served with coleslaw and fries. Two sliders come to an order, but with the fries, it's really filling. Last, but not least, the Korean BBQ pork ribs ($7HH) are amazing. These babies are super tender and fall right off the bone. They also come with fries.   If that isn't enough for you, they also have some delicious miso soup. Not on the happy hour menu, but still tasty and worth it.   Overall, a great sushi place. I will definitely be back!

Ambiance very nice, but the food was OK at best.  I would have given it three stars, but when you take the price (very high) into consideration, it just isnt worth it.  Nothing bad, just not worth $60 for lunch.  Very, very average taste and we ordered the signature rolls.  There are dozens of sushi places in Phoenix where you can get sushi at least as good as Pure for half the cost.  One more thing - the maguro was pretty low quality - pale pink in color as opposed to the bright red that you would expect at a restaurant of this caliber (or at least this price).

Busy eatery in a retail shopping area.  The inside was packed for happy hour on a Saturday.  Our group opted to sit outside on the patio.  The service was friendly and fast.  We had an assortment from the happy hour food choices, beer & wine,  everything was delicious, including the side of shoestring sweet potatoes.

I was driving around the other day and noticed Pure Sushi and remember thinking I am going to have to try that place out! Thankfully, I didn't have to wait long at all! A friend and I were looking for a place to check out for dinner and we both wanted sushi so I suggested we check out Pure Sushi over our usual joints. The decor inside is appealing, and very minimal, lots of white!  Service was fantastic throughout our entire meal, our waitress was really on top of things was helpful and friendly.   The two stand out items of the entire meal was the Fire Dragon Roll which has shrimp tempura, spicy tuna and cucumber inside, fresh tuna with cilantro and jalapeno on top, served with spicy poke sauce. It's fresh and flavorful and the spicy poke sauce with the cilantro and jalapeño really brings it over the top!  They have amazing happy hour specials from 3-6pm Monday through Friday and 11-6pm on Saturday and Sundays. I have heard amazing things about their poke and sea bass so those are my next must try items!   I def can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!
I am blown away this place has a 4 star rating. What a total misrepresentation!  Felt like I was at an overpriced Teharu.

Their nigiri salmon is delicious, fresh and has no fishy taste.  I love that they add wasabi under the fish. I have eaten the Sea Bass, that is flaky warm and tasty, some of the best I've had.  I've never eaten anything I didn't love.  Their tempura udon is also awesome.  The servers here are wonderful, and love to make conversation.  The best time to go is Happy Hour, they have great sushi and appetizer deals.  I "heart" Pure Sushi.

Pure used to be our favorite place, but after our most recent experience, we will never be stoping in again. We showed up at 1:40p on a Sunday. It took about 5 minutes for someone to tell us "sit wherever you want" and then not even have someone pour us water until 15 minutes later. After another 10 minutes of not having anyone acknowledge that we were there we decided to leave. The man (who looked like he was in charge) didn't even say anything as we walked out the door. We told him why we were leaving, but he didn't even respond. It was truly a shame. We went to Sushi Brokers instead and had a fabulous experience.

so today i had my first pure sushi lunch, i was right by there on my lunch break & ordered two california rolls to go.. The place looked very modern, very nice.. the staff was super nice, and the whole place gave me a good vibe. My california rolls were delicious. this place is somewhere i will definately keep going to.
Great food! Our server Is amazing! Love the atmosphere and definitely recommend the chicken katsu!

We came here for Father's Day and waited 40 minutes for our food. We ordered drinks along with the chicken katsu, salmon sashimi, salmon/tuna nigiri, and the king crab roll. It took them an hour to begin making the king crab roll which seemed a bit ridiculous. Although the drinks were very good, the food and prices were definitely not worth the wait.
The salad and sushi was wonderful! We are visiting so some friends recommended pure sushi. The coconut shrimp is really good to start with. Very intimate and cozy setting.

My husband and I visit this neighborhood sushi restaurant pretty much twice a week . We are treated like family!  The Happy Hour is a tremendous value. This is our home away from home !  The salmon poke bowl is a favorite. Great dragon roll ..  The best is feeling like family every time we visit !
Chilean Sea Bass! Melt in your mouth delicate deliciousness........had to update! Oh and for dessert Chocolate Mochi Icecream.....a truely tasty and original dessert.
One of our favorite sushi restaurants and a great happy hour. Servers are knowledgeable.   The outside patio is nice.

I went alone to Pure Sushi being new to Scottsdale,   this place needs warmer friendlier hostesses that understand a single diner doesn't want to sit at table for 4 right by front door,  the sushi bar or cocktail lounge would always be better.  And this is what I requested.  She asked me why I was there....to eat....duh. Very unprofessional.   Then she asked me how many people.....hummmm came in alone and told her table for one.  Sushi chef was friendly and chatted a little.  I'll go back but I will mention something if I'm greeted this way again.  Happy Hour pricing is pretty good.  Pretty good wine list.

Have been frequenting Pure since it opened.  Food is exceptional.  Service is either great or meh.  This is a fine place for Sushi fans as well as folks like me who prefer cooked food, LOL.  Pretty presentation and cool ambiance.  It's not a very big place, (although there is an attached patio dining area) so it's crowded in Season...but so worth the wait!

Pure is, unfortunately, my new sushi place. This blows because it's all the way out in the boonies, for chrissakes. It's on, like, 923875987235th street and Hayden (no offense, Kristen.).  So, there's that. BUT! They are expanding to Old Town, which only puts them 4 light years away from me, as opposed to 17. Woo-hoo!  I'm complainy right now because of all the boozy bowling last night with you yelpers, FYI.  At any rate, try the Veggie Tempura... it's absolutely out of this world dreamy. It's very light, and they don't deep fry the whole veggie, they actually julienne everything, make it into little birds nest thingies, then fry it. They also add a clump of mashed daikon sprouts to the tempura so you can digest the oil better.   Our server, Jenna, was just AWESOME and gave us some great pointers on the more uncommon effects of Sea Urchin. Hooray for aphrodisiacs. We also had this lobster roll thing with a sweet cream and tempura lobster. SO GOOD.  The prices were really great, I thought. Less pricey than Stingray.  Jew mom also gave it big thumbs up!

We usually love pure sushi, and usually have pretty good service. We decided to order take out, on the phone they told me it would be 30 minutes, not a problem-but 30 minute later we show up and have to wait an additional 30 minutes. And the customer service was they worst we have encountered.  A normal day I'd give this place a 4/5 stars, but customer arrive is very important to me and unfortunately we may not go back

I take out from here all the time. Great Bento Boxes for lunch, and awesome happy hour menu. The Fire Dragon rolls are my favorite, as well as the Sashimi Platter. The atmosphere is cool and contemporary, great for a date evening or lunch with friends. The service is good too!
Very fresh sushi. California rolls and shrimp tempura rolls are excellent. Quick service.

Last night was a disaster at Pure, they were busy and short-staffed (only 2 sushi chefs). The man working Expo was a total jerk to the chefs constantly yelling and making rude comments loud enough for customers to hear.  This was a regular place we enjoyed going but now will think twice about visiting again.  When we asked why there were only 2 chefs we were told that our favorite chef EJ was in an auto accident which alarmed us - fortunately we had his contact information so immediately texted to make sure he was ok only to find out he quit the job and didn't get into an accident (thank goodness).  The rolls we ordered came out ugly and loosely rolled - the sushi chef even apologized as he was handing them to us.  It was not a good night at Pure - something needs to change.

Salmon skin hand roll was tasty.  Also ordered a sashimi dinner plate and a SeaBass on forbidden rice.  Several mistakes were made during the evening.   1. Out of the fish, offered a different fish but forgot to place the order. 2. Brought some kind of sushi roll instead of sashimi dinner plate. 3. Waited for the fish entree while watching companion eat his sashimi dinner when it finally came. The food was not bad and ambience was ok.  Just need to work on the service level.

First time here over the weekend. Service was decent. Our bartender was nice and welcoming. He was knowledgeable about the menu as well as the sakes available at his bar.  We found ourselves waiting around a bit while our sushi sat to be ran to our table...knew it was ours due to only one other couple being in the restaurant. I didn't like the Miso soup. It was loaded with mushrooms as opposed to being garnished. The soft shell crab appetizers was really good and a dish I will definitely get again.  The manager was there and shared some "one ofs" for remaining Scotch.   Overall experience was good, food was good and people were nice.
Loving this place! Fresh fish, creative sashimi dishes. Gotta try to Hamachi Spoons next visit. Must haves: the coconut shrimp, spring rolls, ahi and avocado poke, and definitely the baked sea bass!!

I have reviewed Pure in the past. I do make a point of giving a restaurant a second chance to make a good impression, unfortunately Pure continues to strike out.  We stopped in for Happy Hour last week. After a variety of average-at-best Sushi, rolls and wine we received our bill and were surprised the prices were higher than we expected. I pulled the Pure website up and saw that the prices on the Happy Hour menu online were lower than the prices on our bill. I brought the discrepancy to the waitress who then engaged the manager. There was no explanation for the difference, no apology from the manager, just an instruction to the waitress to adjust our check.  How many other people have looked at Pure online, and then gone and paid a bill of higher prices without realizing they had been scammed? We have given Pure a couple of chances to prove they can deliver a good quality product and a good price. Unfortunately I think this price gouging is a little sleazy. We will never be back!

I have never seen/had the creamy lobster roll at any other sushi place-I'm glad I tried it. The battered lobster and cream sauce on top was a unique combination. The ambiance was classy without being stuffy. The weather was great for the patio. We got there early at 4:00pm, and had great service. The crowd started showing up as we were leaving though

I'd like to write a review of this place, but the thing is I have no clue how the food is. After seeing the decent ratings and the fact that my last two favorite sushi places have shut down I decided to get dressed really cute and my boyfriend and I left around 3 this afternoon to try out the happy hour. Whenever we go to a new restaurant we like to sample a lot of different things and happy hour always helps because prices are lower. So we drive the half hour south and arrive at Pure. There were two groups of people sitting inside, and the patio looked nice so we decided to sit out there. After five minutes or so a waiter brought out waters (which a fly landed on the rim of my glass not a split second after it was put on the table, I know they can't control the outside insects but it was still gross!) so when I wanted some water I drank my bf's. I asked our waiter if the happy hour was only at the bar or if we could order off it outside as well and his response went a little something like this... "ummmmm, uhhhhh, welllllll we don't have happy hour here, that was at our south location and they ummm closed, we haven't updated our website yet to say that but yeah, we don't do happy hour." I was shocked. The fact that only one of their locations did happy hour should have been written on the website in the first place. They are LYING to get business, and have hungry people show up only to find they have to pay $15 for a roll. No thanks. We aren't cheap eaters by any means, but we draw the line at false advertising. Thanks for the bad water.

Hung out during happy hour with "Jules", who made us feel at home, turned us onto some new cocktails and we all had fun.  By far one of the more expensive sushi restaurants, but that might have had to do with our huge appetite and dozens of drinks.  A great spot for sushi, and beautiful all white decor.  Although I can't imagine how much the janitor's life sucks keeping it clean.

I came here on a Sunday after church at about 1130ish. I walked in and was told I could sit anywhere. I chose to sit at the bar because I was by myself. The waitress that helped me was great. They have a happy hour menu for Sunday's and the same one for certain hours during the week. On the happy hour menu select rolls, appetizers, and alcoholic beverages are cheaper. I asked my waitress what she recommended and of the 3 recommendations she gave me I chose the Fire Dragon Roll. It was delicious! If you don't like a lot of heat (spice) then I don't recommend this for you. I also ordered edamame with my roll. The only complaint I had was that there was quite a bit of salt on the edamame. Overall I had a great experience and pleased with the happy hour prices. This might become my after church ritual!

Great food and service however the owners need to check the kitchen ventilation system as every time you're there, you leave smelling like the fry oil !! We really like Pure however we've had to opt to sitting outside only.

This is by far the best sushi in town.  The place is always great.  Happy Hour menu has some awesome values.  The same bar tenders have been their for years and remember you and your likes.  Every time I go somewhere else for sushi I always say, "should have gone to Pure..."
Poor customer service.  This used to be our neighborhood sushi stop.  Not anymore.  Disappointing.
In the world of sushi these guys are just ok. Way to expensive for the quality. Service generally sucks. There are too many other options. Stick to the rolls. For real such go somewhere else.

We used to be big fans of Pure with a visit approx 3x a month.  At one point a couple years ago, the food service and quality became, for lack of a better term, lazy.  Periodically we return to see if things have changed.  Last night returned for the first time in about a year and unfortunately found not much has changed.  They somehow have moved away from a more classy menu to this big plastic sheet.  Makes me think of being at chillis..... In addition there was some sticky stuff on the menu which I wasn't to pleased about avoiding.  We started with the pork dumplings.  They were loose, a little cold and a tasted as though they had been sitting around for some time.  This is curious because we received them about 2 minutes after they were ordered.  The more important part for us is the sushi itself.   We had:   Pinwheel.... Sloppily put together.  Fish was extremely thick. Tuna, yellowtail, seabass nigiri.  Everything was warm and we believed the sushi was not cut right it somehow seemed hard, lacking of the proper texture and simply did not taste fresh.  The server was very good by the way.  For our money ,we will stick with stingray and probably try pure again in another year.  I imagine they plan to be around since they committed to the great expense of plastic menus.

First, I have to say I don't tend to write a review unless I like the place, but this place was just bad. It is waaaaay overpriced, even for sushi! The service was not so great, the waitresses seemed way too cool to be taking care of us. The sushi I would say was good, but not great. I had one roll the was really good, the rest were middle of the road. I would not recommend.

Good happy hour. We always sit at the bar and chat with the ever amusing Lara. I love the rice-free rolls. The Lollipop roll made with real crab (no crab mix/mayo) is THE best. Last night we were starving at 3pm after moving all day, so we stopped in for happy hour appetizers. Awesome deals. I had a HUGE plate of the Yellowfin and Ahi Tuna Poke for $6 I think. It kept me full until dinner at 8pm. BF had the Shrimp Tempura roll, BF's mom had the California roll. Pretty standard choices, but great as always. No reason to sit at a table here -- the bar has it all and we can even watch the game! We'll be back for sure.

Overpriced sushi place in N Scottsdale. We went in for dinner with the family and there was a lot of issues with the food and service.  A few other guests were also complaining. The sushi was well below par for the prices and everything was slow. The kids used the chop stick trainers and liked them, so that's one good takeaway.

Great happy hour. Had three rolls. A lobster roll, spicy ahi and tempura and a third can't remember the name but on the happy hour list. All we're great.   Good ribs and pot stickers also.   The staff helped push this to a 5star for opening a fresh bottle of wine for me when I was drinking by the glass.

This is by far the best sushi in the area... They didn't have "Inari" or even know what it was, but their sushi was fresh, delish, and not OTT pricey. Def has become our "go to" sushi restaurant from now on.

This place had some great sushi and sashimi selection. Ordered a vegas roll, it was great. The squid, salmon, sweet shrimp and scallop sushi was great too quite fresh but chef could do a better job in fish cutting. Sushi rice was too much and too mushy. Wine selection were limited but had variety of drinks. Lastly sweet shrimp head was fried but was inside. Biggest disappointment of the night.

I popped in here during happy hour, and at that time the appetizers menu is very affordable. The service was excellent. The food is very nicely prepared and if you are into the 'fusion scene', probably exactly what you are seeking. The real wasabi was excellent, and the wasabi mayo drizzle was an interesting and tasty touch.The korean BBQ ribs were great. Worth checking out.
YUM!  This place is great.  The In & Out roll was our favorite but the Chicken Teriyaki and fried rice were awesome as well.  Wish we were in town longer as we would definitely return!

Delightful experience! I came in with my 2 little ones alone. Jay was our waiter, and a very good one. He got the chefs to prepare their sunsine roll with orange and passionfruit dressing, because I am highly allergic to mango. He was very accomodating. I also had the seared tuna tataki, which was also excellent. My kids had miso soup and their fried rice; both were very good. I was very surprised that a strip mall sushi joint would be thay delicious. Thumbs up!!

We came here after a football game. My son was having a craving for Japanese. So we found Pure Sushi on Yelp.   Walked in and it was pretty busy. Luckily they had one table available inside and we took it. Place is very modern looking. Little elegance to it with white curtains. Almost everything white.   My son ordered the miso soup and surprised he thought that it was really good. He then ordered the chicken teriyaki. It was basically a breast of chicken that requires a knife and fork. He didn't complain about it and ate it all up.   My wife ordered the Nabeyaki Udon which was basically a seafood Udon soup. It had shrimp, shrimp tempura, scallops. Soup was really good. Noodles nice a fresh. So she liked it and I was able try some too and have to say it was good.   This is the problem I have with this place. If you know me I really hate to complain but this is just unacceptable. Both my wife and son are really slow eaters and usually takes them a good 30 minutes to eat. Saying this I ordered the eel and avocado bowl and we ordered the baked scallop roll too.   Both my son and wife finished their meal and I didn't get my dinner or our appetizers of the baked scallops roll. Our waitress apologized a few times and then had to get the manger. I was basically eating my wife's leftovers cause I was starving.   The manager apologized but came up with some lame excuses that they had 30 sushi orders but when he told me this half the tables were already gone. So don't know how this could be a valid excuse. He also said the hot dishes and sushi kitchen was so busy but then how did they get my son and wife order out as a hot dish but miss mine. So his excuses was a joke. I was so mad that I told him I just want the bill for what my family ate and I will go to Panda Express.   He told me no but he actually took off the eel avocado bowl and baked scallop roll from my bill. The least he could do. It actually came out pretty quickly after my conversation with the manager.   Seriously, 30+ minutes for a eel and avocado bowl. It was basically rice with slices of avocado on top of a nice piece of eel. It had a scoop of crab mix on top. Nothing special and plus my mood was ruined.   The baked scallop roll was actually put in the oven. Plate was really hot. Didn't look like scallops on the sushi. Looked more like clams but what do I know. Anyways, it was okay.   So I can't really blame it on the waitress. She did a good job taking care of our table by filling up or glasses. Again the kitchen was terrible. Screwing up my order. Making me wait 30 plus minutes and giving me all these lame excuses. Unacceptable   Not a place I want to visit again. There are too many Japanese and sushi places to visit. It might have been one time but 30+ minutes. Never again  Oh yea should have given them a one or two star review but up it one star cause he took my meal and our sushi off the bill.

Sushi was not that great . Got two specialty rolls .. Waitress was very good until Her' end .. We just started eating .. Probably going to order more.. And she gave us the check cuz she was going on break .. Very unprofessional and rude. Will not be going back ..the people giving this place good reviews do not know good sushi !

This has always been one of my favorite sushi spots in scottsdale. If I'm craving sushi this is my first happy hour spot. There deals and prices for the quality of fish you get is unbeatable. From the sushi to drinks, all is amazing. My favorite drink is there cucumber gin martini. Servers are the only down side as they seem a little unprofessional or disengaged with their job. They also have a ton of young staff always hanging around the bathroom/ kitchen area doing nothing. This seems slightly weird and makes for overcrowding. Overall, this is a great spot for a sushi craving. I LOVE that there happy is till 6 on Saturday's!!

I came here after reading through the yelp reviews hoping to have some great sushi.... Unfortunately this was not the case. As I sit here at 9pm after eating at pure sushi I feel disappointed and dissatisfied. Rice was way too sticky. Fish was stale. Service was ok. Would not return. Would not recommend.

This is one of my favorite places to meet my girlfriend before our facials and or mani/pedi! Awesome happy hour with a variety of appetizers. Sushi is good for a quick fix. The only thing I could say is that the edamame never seems fresh and is over cooked, but otherwise, love the service and food is good! Perfect for a Saturday or Sunday afternoon delight!

For this neighborhood, I had high expectations for this place!  The surrounding area has a lot of really good places.  We ordered the Ahi Tuna appetizer which had a weird flavor and the accompanying chips were stale.  ten sushi roll (I think it was the Vegas) wasn't fresh and tasted like it had been sitting out for a couple hours.  None of the dishes we ordered were high quality or fresh.  With so many great sushis place this was a disappointment.

This is my favorite sushi place in the valley.  I am glad it is near home.  Love the Poke here (not authentic - but they put a delicious spin on it)!  The sashimi is always fresh (sometimes a challenge for AZ sushi places).  I enjoy maki wrapped in cucmber and they have a few really good choices here for those.  Happy Hour is a steal and I like the Korean BBQ pork sliders a lot (which I hate to admit ordering these at a sushi restaurant with such great sushi).    My only negative is service can be hit or miss, even within a meal.  In this case, super attentive until dinner was served and then no water or drink service for quite a while.  We would have stayed a while and ordered more beers and drinks after dinner, but we decided to leave since it would have taken a while.

Love this place. Close to home. Service and atmosphere is always great.  Happy hour menu is limited but good choices and value. My favorites are the "Crunch" and "Fire Dragon" rolls.  I typically go around 4 o'clock to beat the crowds.  Never disappointed.

I love this place on the weekend because they offer a great happy hour menu between 11am-6pm. The best appetizers are Yellowfin Ahi and Avocado Poke, Lettuce Wraps, and the Pork Gyoza, I order their salmon rolls (both regular and spicy) and rainbow rolls most of the time as well. Nothing particularly fancy but I think tastes great and can't beat the price ($3 and $4).  I don't go to this place unless it's happy hour because I think it is expensive and not worth the money for what you're getting...so check the time!
Popped in for a quick bite after work, great rolls and service. Will defining be back!

Let me preface this by saying that I do like Pure's sushi, however, their service is really subpar despite this trying economy. Last weekend, a buddy and I went to the restaurant where we were greeted by a cute hostess who made us wait for 20 minutes with available tables in sight. We were then seated on the patio at the only table without a space heater. From there, we sat staring at each other for an additional 25 minutes without a greeting from any of Pure's staff members who glided past us with smiles on their faces and plates and plates of food. Finally fed up, we grabbed a busboy who brought a manager to our table. He played his whole shocked and embarrassed card, but in the end offered nothing for our trouble other than, "Can I get you something now?" What a joke! I used to like Pure, but I certainly don't have any plans on going back, at least not to the North Scottsdale location.
The sushi here is REALLY good. The fish is tender and the service was great. Our food came out fast and the ambiance is wonderful too. Loved my experience and will be coming back soon!

Great Sushi! I was on vacation in Phoenix, and wanted sushi... went here and was not disappointed! The sushi was really good. I thought the prices were very fair. Everyone was super friendly. Would recommend if you're looking for great sushi in this area!

So happy there is a new owner. They changed a few things and made it a lot more enjoyable! New fun things on the menu great Sushi chefs (DJ is awesome). Love the changes and a happy place to be. Weekly visit if not more! Great job guys!

Pure Sushi is Pure Sensation!   I came here for restaurant week with a classmate, and I must say:   One of the Best sushi Places in Az.   I'm not one to give 5 stars unless its a Yelp Party that I'm going to, but this place definitely deserves it. The place truly delivers.   Favorite part of the meal:  Ahi & Avocado Poke - Fresh ahi & avocado w/truffle infused veg & taro chips   Next fave: Sashimi-Nigiri plate - three types of sashimi & two nigiri   Do not order again, ever:  Mochi Plate - Japanese ice cream balls covered in sweet rice paste   The mochi plate was not even soft -- it was hard, like freezer burn awful.  Despite the mishap on the mochi ice cream, I loved the place. I'll have to come back again for happy hour. Also notable dishes was the Fire Dragon Roll.  What to get again: Anything that is fresh fish. It is a rare find to find sushi so fresh and so delightful. Come for the fresh fish!
My Favorite Sushi Spot! Their Happy Hour is AMAZING & I always feel like we get great service.

Pure is a beautiful restaurant with exceptional service and wonderful Japanese food and sushi. Great appetizers are ribs, edamame, miso soup, and calamari. Their rolls  are a little pricey, but they offer happy hour prices so definitely check that out. We've also had their tempura vegetable dinner and their salmon dinner as well as bento boxes at lunchtime and all are great. If you want great tasting, clean, sumptuous Japanese food/sushi in a beautiful environment, try Pure.

Wow, visitied last evening after reading reviews on yelp for tuna poke. Excellent, excellent sushi for fair price in Scottsdale area. Would be 5 stars except came in around 8:30 and restaurant closed at 9,  servers wanted to go home and we were rushed. Food tho, excellent. Will try again during week, but they are not late night on Sunday, lol, and they let you know.

Well, you all were right !! Sushi Delicioso! Went for happy hour and it was way better than I expected. The Crunch Roll is the bomb! Ill have 2 next time, and was so good I am going back Friday. Beautiful atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff . ***** starz from me Fresh n delicious

Good sushi, pretty attentive wait staff, and a nice patio.  The sushi was good, but wasn't amazing. Granted, we mostly are off of the happy hour menu, so it was more reasonably priced.  We did have some challenges finding a dessert that they had in stock and they completely forgot my dessert in the confusion.  I would definitely go again, but probably only during happy hour.

I was a big fan of this place for a long time.  Recently though, the service has really declined and the quality has been inconsistent.  The last two times I went our order was very messed up.  When we talked with the manager he acted as if it was our fault... very strange.  I suspect if they don't get their service sorted out they will share same fate as Stingray.

We enjoyed a delicious lunch on the recommendation from Amber at The Sheraton. We started with a seafood salad and a crunchy roll. My husband really enjoyed his salad with the ahi and salmon and octopus and the side of spicy poke sauce. I loved my crunchy roll with siracha sauce on it. The best treat was the salmon jaw. It was absolutely delicious. The skin was so crispy and we put teriyaki and siracha sauce on it. Try it you won't be disappointed!!
Pure Sushi was pretty good - My wife really likes this joint a lot.  I thought it was a little overpriced, myself.  I definitely recommend the tuna sashimi and the Fire Dragon Roll.

Despite seating available inside we were given outside seating, the same seating was still open as we finished up.  One of the two heaters was not working and the working one stopped halfway through dinner. The sushi was very good. I liked the Box Sushi, and the Ika was great.  Service was friendly and fairly attentive. If i could, i would give 3.5 stars rather than four.

It just didn't knock my socks off. Maybe I was expecting too much from some of the previous reviews but it was fairly mediocre in my book.  The restaurant itself was trendy but was nothing out the ordinary.... no memorable qualities or specific ambience.  Typical swanky/ expensive sushi place.    The waitstaff was definitely subpar.  Two different servers asks for our orders and it was apparent that they were as confused as we were and that no one was terribly organized.    The sushi was good, just not fantastic.  The rolls and menu options were very standard. Overall I think there are better sushi places out there to try, especially for the price tag.

Had an extended family happy our at Pure Sushi last week. It was fun! We sat on the patio and the space was wonderful. Very cool decor as well.   With all those folks who have differing ideas on food, we didn't do our typical sushi thing & didn't actually order. Had a bunch of the specialty rolls. I tried the crunchy roll, sakesake roll, potato spicy tuna roll & some yakotori. Everything was tasty. Of all that I tried, I definitely liked the sakesake roll best (spicy crab mix, cucumber & asparagus inside, fresh salmon & sweet onions on top served with some sort of apple sauce - not that apple sauce). It was good. The potato spicy tuna roll was interesting as well with sweet chili sauce and fried julienne potatoes on top.  Think I missed the albacore ceviche roll which I heard was quite good. Definitely some other interesting looking items on the menu as well.  The one criticism that I'd mention was that the service, while quite nice, was very slow and they were not crazy busy or anything.  I'd definitely like to go back & try some other funky items & their more traditional sushi but it'll probably have to wait until someone else organizes a visit. Hard for us to put it ahead of the more traditional style places we love.

We made reservations online for 5:30 seeming it was a Friday night and most places are packed at the time we wanted to go. The place was a little hard to find since it was in a weird area and the trees were covering the sign but we found it. The place is actually quite small but I saw people walking in and out of a back area so i'm assuming there was more seating back there. We had a table and at first it was wiggling but a waiter came over to fix it by putting something underneath a leg so I appreciated that since it annoyed me it was wiggling. The seat I sat on was super squishy like I was sitting on a sofa almost, which I didn't really like. It wasn't loud at all, which was a plus. The menu is a little pricey but I assumed the food better be damn good for it to be that much. Our waitress was nice, she checked up on us to do refills and ask how we liked the good, which I appreciated instead of being ignored. Now the food. My mom and I got sushi. We ordered the avocado roll, the spicy tuna roll and the fire dragon roll. We had to wait about 15 minutes which wasn't too bad. The Fire Dragon Roll was $15. When we got the food I was very disappointed. There was about 6 rolls for the avocado roll and 8 for the spicy tuna roll which was normal, I wasn't upset about that at all. Now, the fire dragon roll, there was ONLY 5 pieces for it. Like are you kidding me?! $15 for 5 pieces! Ridiculous! Way over priced for the quantity you get. It should have came with at LEAST 8 not 5. That's really expensive for the amount. I could go to Sushi Brokers and get probably 9 pieces of sushi for $15. I suggest you either lower the prices because of the amount you get or add more rolls to the items because it is way overpriced. I would give this place 3/5 stars but the customer service was great but the amount of sushi we got knocked a star off.

Super nice manager Brett who was incredibly accommodating to my friend and I when we wanted to change tables. Fish was fresh and delicious, and the sushi chefs are very entertaining to watch as well. Definitely will be coming back!

Love this place! Great food, great service!! Great bartenders! Love Josie and Danielle!  We had everything on the Happy hour menu and it was amazing and reasonably priced! Josie makes a mean Old Fashion!!

One of the best sushi establishments I've ever been to. Quick sushi chefs, quality specials, & clean atmosphere.    Highlights during my visit was the Spanish Bluefin Tuna which was perfectly marbled & an absolute treat as sashimi.  Also, was that they offer fresh wasabi instead of that cheap paste you find everywhere else. Nothing like fresh wasabi to take your sushi dining experience to the next level.    I'm looking forward to my next visit there to try out their next special.
Loved the space. Huge PURE makes one wall. The service was great. Casual but helpful. Went with their suggestion on some drinks and rolls and loved them all. More action later in the night for sure.

Had this been our first time here we would not ever come back. We chose to sit at a high top table in the bar area.  Note to self..... Don't sit in the bar area for dinner!  The service was terrible.  We were served by the busy bartender. And she was not excited about coming out from behind the bar. The food was good, although the ginger was course, rubbery and hard to chew.   Our order was messed up twice!  We didn't get our whole sushi order ( which was corrected), and a roll order never showed up. Both times required a get up and go to bar to inform our bartender/server.  Very disappointing to say the least.   it would probably be a good idea to have the bartender stay behind the bar and not try to be a server at the same time.   It will be awhile before we go try a do over.  Not sure I am up for another chance.   But when and if we do, we will not sit in the bar area!   The owner was too busy chatting with all of the ladies at the bar and making sure they were happy, rather than checking on other customers to see how their dining experience was.  I would have been happy to share with him.  Our first visit there was totally the opposite.  Too bad we couldn't have that repeated.  Hmm, maybe third time is a charm.

A hungry group of girls (most from out of town) + Pure  = Yum!  We could not have picked a more beautiful day to have lunch out on the patio at Pure. For those of you who have read some of my previous reviews, you know that sushi is not necessarily at the top of my list of lunch choices, but when in Rome.......  The atmosphere was cool and chic, but not pretentious or overbearing. Our waitress was very friendly and within minutes of sitting down, we had popped open a bottle of champagne and were toasting our resident birthday girl.  The lunch menu was extensive (and not all about the raw stuff - yay for me!) and we had a hard time deciding what to order. We finally selected the Edamame for starters, then had several of the Creamy Bake Lobster rolls (sheer perfection , I tell you!), the Shrimp Tempura roll and the Sashimi platter. I ate heartily from the Lobster and Shrimp rolls, but left the Sashimi to the hardcore sushi worshipers.   Overall, the food was 5 stars, but the service became somewhat lax throughout the meal. Our waitress was nice enough, but it appeared that she might have been overbooked with tables.

Pure is amazing and so is Ellie the manager who helped with catering my event last week! The food was kept fresh and hot and put out in just the right amounts. None was wasted and everyone loved the variety. I will use them again for sure at my next event!

Tried this place yesterday and it was delicious! We got so much food for so little money with the Happy Hour deals!!  We first tried the Pork Gyoza and it was amazing!! We also got the Calamari and the sauce that came with it was sooo good!! We had the Vegetable Fried Rice as well and at this point, we were so full!! BUT we couldn't stop eating because it was all so good so we ordered some sushi rolls!!  I had the Crunchy Tempura Roll and we also tried the Spicy Tuna. Definitely preferred the Spicy Tuna with crab mix over the Shrimp Tempura Roll, but they both hit the spot! We could not finish everything- but that meant delicious left-overs!  I will definitely be back, Pure Sushi!

Previously had enjoyed dining at this upscale sushi restaurant.  Disappointed with the decline in service on a Monday night.  Ordered a few sushi rolls and nigiri.  Took over 45 minutes for items to come out.  Waitress rarely checked in on us.  When we complained about the speed of service, she gave us attitude.  Better places in Scottsdale/Phoenix to spend your money and have a good dining experience.

Good place for real sushi. Please note I do not consider California Roll to be actual sushi. Sushi is tuna or yellowtail or salmon: anything raw. Get it with rice, get it with sauce, get it however you want. But don't tell me how you ate really good sushi the other day when you ordered California Roll.   That said I loved the In & out roll here! Also try the listed cucumber cocktail. Best cocktail I have had in Scottsdale. Very cute decor here.

3.5 stars.  It's ironic that the name of the restaurant is "Pure Sushi" because in my opinion, this place is good if you are into fusion rolls...they are very creative. Ambiance is nice,  decor is trendy, but prices are a little high.   We started with the Yellowfin Ahi and Avocado Poke which had white truffle in it and was served on individual taro chips (6 I think?). While it was tasty, refreshing and had a nice presentation, the truffle flavor was a little strong for me. You cannot appreciate the yellowfin at all. We also ordered the salmon and albacore sahsimi and the ikura. Fish tasted fresh and was a pretty good cut.   We also ordered the Fire Dragon Roll and Peppered Beef Roll. I know, I know, why order beef at a sushi place? Well, it is a fusion restaurant after all. And surprisingly the beef roll was my favorite of what we tried. The mushroom, asparagus, and sesame sauce all worked really well with the peppered beef. Mmm. The fire dragon roll was definitely spicy. It was tasty but it was kind of a glorified spicy tuna roll. We went for restaurant week and I would consider coming back for happy hour if I was in the area.

I used to love this place been coming here for years. Pricy but always worth it. today  not so much- empty dining room one bartender/waitress. Took 10 minutes to bring waters. Sushi was far from fresh- took forever to get our check let alone acknowledge us on our meal- all around horrific just praying I don't get food poisoning.

While Jem's "It's Amazing" is playing overhead...I'm sipping a pear martini as well as  discovering my new favorite appetizer: Yellowfin Ahi And Avocado Poke with white truffle infused asian vegetables on crispy taro chips. Like the song, "It's Amazing!" Some people hear "white truffle" and go right to heaven at the thought...but not this girl. I seldom care for it, but absolutely found it "done right" with the flavors here.   We've been to "Pure" many-a-time both for Happy Hour and regular dining and this place keeps us coming back over the years for the friendly service, the quality of the sushi (and other items) as well as the location/ambiance and pricing. While not inexpensive, it's fair for the area as well as the portion/quality and the service has always remained professional as well as fun.  I love the interior design and prefer sitting at or near the sushi bar.   The pulled pork sliders and sweet potato fries also hit the spot as did the spicy tuna lettuce wraps. If there is one roll that I wouldn't recommend, it'd be the rainbow. Consistently, a little on the small side (compared to other sushi spots) and Pure has many other rolls that will do you better. Their Happy Hour menus has a great selection across the board. Here's the lollipop from a few years back: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pure-sushi-scottsdale?select=RTZIo6QHcJa2ElQPXz4EFQ#RTZIo6QHcJa2ElQPXz4EFQ  They take reservations and you may need them! It fills up, especially on the weekends.
Pure is my new favorite spot! GREAT food and atmosphere! I have been twice and was very pleased but be sure to make a reservation or not be in a hurry!
This is my favorite sushi bar in the area.   They have a delicious Hamachi kama and excellent lunch specials.   They also have a happy hour menu which includes all day on Saturday and Sunday.
Great service and very good rolls. Good price points for very tasty food. I liked the environment and had a good time.

I came here for lunch.  I ordered the sashimi and sushi lunch.  The fish was not as fresh as it normally is. I have eaten here several times and the fish was always fresh and very good.  Could it be we came here towards the end of the week and the fish isn't as fresh???  However, the guest that came with me ordered the bento box and that was very good.  Miso soup was very tasty, with tofu, seaweed and mushroom.  At least the service was amazing.

One of my local favorites.  They take sushi rolls and do fun and interesting things I haven't seen from others.  Peppered beef roll is my favorite!!  White Cosmo's go down very smooth!  Thank goodness I can walk there.    Sushi?  Sadly I always try there salads and rolls, never really made it to the traditional sashumi
Just had lunch and I have to say when it comes to quality Pure is head and shoulders above most spots in AZ.  Everything we had was fresh and of high quality.  We will be back for sure
Great staff, great food, fresh sushi. Natasha is a great waitress and Hudson is the great sushi chef. They have great happy hour specials and interesting sushi rolls.

Pretty pricey but if you want good sushi you got to shell out a little. Took a friend out for dinner for one of my last nights in Scottsdale before moving back to the east coast. Started off with some delicious beverages, but decided to stay away from the saki this time. Instead started with their pear martini which hit the spot. Then my order of miso soup came. I think miso soup pretty much taste the same where ever you go, but this one stood out for its exceptional taste. Me and my friend got a variety of nigiri, handrolls, and rolls. So good we order even more pieces of nigiri for dinner after stuffing out faces. The bill was certainly on the high end for two people but a good time.

It's a very pretty restaurant, but until you see the bathroom, it might change your mind. I have been there a few times thinking the sushi would be better on my next visit....it is NOT.  It tastes rotten, and the rice is dried out. The servers have snotty attitudes, and the service is excruciatingly slow.    One more thing: The bathroom was FILTHY and DISGUSTING. The floor and walls and sink were so dirty, and there was dried diarrhea splatter all over the toilet. It was so unbelievably gross that I immediately ran out of the bathroom.  That is a tell-tale sign of a dirty restaurant.  I should probably call the health department.  After seeing that bathroom, I would never go back.
Very good, moderately priced sushi. Not exceptional like Roka Akor, but very good as a regular sushi place.

We stopped in for a snack between lunch and dinner and luckily caught some great HH specials!    The restaurant was virtually empty on a Friday around 3pm, but I didn't mind much as we were in a hurry.  We sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed the company of the chef.    The service was a little bit rock to start off as I think 3 different people tried to take our order, but once it got rolling- we were good to go.   I had some Sea Bass Nigiri ($3 for 2 pieces), Spicy Tuna Roll ($3-4), Edamame ($1.50), and a wonderful house salad topped with sliced pears and a delicious house dressing ($3).  The fish was all very fresh and clean tasting, but the salad was honestly my favorite!
One of the BEST salads I've ever had - the seafood salad. A perfect mix of seafood (salmon, tuna, octopus, etc) and greens.
